characters: JAGGED DORSAL FINS ALONG HIS BACK--
GODZILLA LEAPS FORWARD SUDDENLY, EXPOSING THE THREE ROWS
TEN MILES NORTHWEST OF TRAVELLER, UTAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stars in the black of space. PAN DOWN to sapphire blue sk brighter stars still shining through. It's Arctic midnigh weak sun tiny on the distant horizon. We SKIM along the w in and around looming glacial cliffs-- The top of an iceberg pushes through the water's surface. Carved into the ice is a single mammoth word:

dialogues.speaker: GODZILLA
dialogues.text: We continue past, along the ocean, and discover: An old fishing boat, the RAINBOW WARRIOR, holds position outside a small natural harbor. All lights extinguished.

dialogues.speaker: FADE UP TITLE
dialogues.text: ARCTIC OCEAN, NEAR THE 170th PARALLEL ON DECK: Eco-warriors peer through high-powered binocular video cameras. Among them: An intense WOMAN. A RUSSIAN MA with a scraggly beard. A surly BLOND MAN, who monitors a counter. All wear heavy parkas against the gray cold.

dialogues.speaker: BLOND MAN
dialogues.text: Can anyone make out the registry? WHAT THEY ARE WATCHING: A distant SALVAGE SHIP, moored in the harbor. Its hoist is swung out over the sea. Flood li illumine salvage divers as they submerge with hoist cable

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN MAN
dialogues.text: Not me. Bojemoi...I think my eyeballs are frozen.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: It's blacked out. Whatever they're up to, it's no goddamn good. Near the salvage ship, the divers guide the cable as the engines begin working, winching the cable up.

dialogues.speaker: BLOND MAN
dialogues.text: (looks up from Geiger counter) Background radiation is nearly a hundred times normal. They're harvesting reactor cores. They must be.

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN MAN
dialogues.text: We don't know that. There's no evidence of--

dialogues.speaker: BLOND MAN
dialogues.text: (pointedly accusing) There's a thirty-year-plus history of Soviets dumping nuclear waste and old reactors into the Kara, the Barents, the Sea of Japan--

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN MAN
dialogues.text: (amused) I swear, I was not there. I had a cold.

dialogues.speaker: BLOND MAN
dialogues.text: So why not the Arctic? Who knows how many of these graveyards there are?

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Something's wrong! The two men re-focus on the salvage ship-- --where crewmen race across the deck. Divers scramble ont platform. A klaxon sounds-- Suddenly the GEIGER COUNTER SQUEALS, readings off the sca The Blond Man drops it, startled.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Shit! The sea begins to BOIL beneath the salvage ship.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Chain reaction! Grab tight-- The sea ERUPTS. The salvage ship is HEAVED into the air. disappears in a FIERY EXPLOSION-- The shock wave rocks the Rainbow Warrior violently. Peopl scramble as the deck tips. Huge chunks of ice peel off th cliffs, crash into the sea, onto the ship. With a cry, th Blond Man falls overboard. Smoke pours from below decks. The Geiger counter calls out an uninterrupted staccato. The Russian Man stumbles blindly through the chaos, grasp  deck rails.

dialogues.speaker: TALL MAN
dialogues.text: ...I can't see...Claus? Martha? Help me!

dialogues.speaker: OBSERVER
dialogues.text: Look at that! The snow can't burn! It can't burn! Near where the remains of the salvage ship, the snow is i on fire--an eerie sight. A fissure has opened up in the glacier, still expanding.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh my god!

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN MAN
dialogues.text: (stumbles toward her) Martha? Where are you? What is happening? The Woman stares toward the shore.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: It's bleeding... RED-BLACK FLUID flows out of the fissure, into the sea. T fluid steams in the chill Arctic air. Turning the ocean b red.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: The Earth is bleeding...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The window is wide open. The curtains don't move. A fan l pointlessly, aimed toward the bed--which is empty. Sudden the mattress JUMPS, bumped from beneath. There is a giggl

dialogues.speaker: KEITH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I thought we got on the floor to cool off.

dialogues.speaker: JILL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh, gee. I'm sorry. I'll stop.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Just an observation. No  complaint. Please, continue. The phone RINGS shrilly.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Dammit. KEITH LLEWELLYN pulls himself out from under the bed to a the phone. He is mid-thirties with a charming smile.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Dr. Llewellyn. (listens; dismayed) How soon? Okay, okay...I'll be ready. (beat) What? Oh, of course. JILL LLEWELLYN has emerged from beneath the bed. A woman high intelligence and strong passions. Keith extends the

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: For you.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: (takes the phone) Dr. Llewellyn. How soon? Yes, I can be ready. She hangs up the phone. Looks at Keith, dismayed.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: The Arctic. Both of us.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: I hate cold weather. Jill pulls him to her. Smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Could be our last chance to be warm for a while... He smiles back at her, leans in to kiss her-- BRIGHT LIGHT FLOODS THE ROOM. The curtains are blown back helicopter settles down outside the window.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Now the government gets efficient?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At an upstairs window, TINA LLEWELLYN looks out. 15 years bright and aching to test boundaries. She peers at the helicopter. A CUTE PILOT guides the ‘copter to the ground. Across the street, a NEIGHBOR and his SON emerge from the house to investigate the noise. Prop wash blows loose a p plastic lawn flamingo. The Neighbor grabs for it. The rotors wind down. The Cute Pilot goes over a checklis looks up--and his eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE PILOT
dialogues.text: Oh, man. Tina is coming toward the ‘copter, wearing T-shirt, tight an underage smile.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE PILOT
dialogues.text: (extends his wrists to co-pilot) Just slap the cuffs on me now and be done with it. Tina reaches the cockpit. The Cute Pilot looks down at hi clipboard, very aware that looking anywhere else could re a morals charge.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE PILOT
dialogues.text: Good evening, miss. Kinda late for you to be up, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: I'm old enough. Across the street, the neighbor clutches his flamingo.

dialogues.speaker: NEIGHBOR
dialogues.text: I don't care how high-up they are...Ever since they moved in, it's one disruption after another.

dialogues.speaker: SON
dialogues.text: (staring at Tina)  I don't mind. Jill and Keith exit the house, carrying parkas and small duffels. Jill sees Tina--and hurries to her. The Cute Pil still studies his clipboard.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Tina...this is hardly an appropriate fashion statement. Keith drapes his parka around Tina's shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: That depends on what I'm trying to say. The Cute Pilot chuckles--and then meets Keith's glare. Refocuses on his clipboard. Jill herds Tina toward the ho into the shelter of the porch and the doorway. Keith foll

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: God, unruffle, mom. It's no big deal--

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: I don't want any problems while we're gone. It'll only be a few days, tops.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: I could go stay with Aunt Julia.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Aunt Julia's rarely home long. We don't want you to be by yourself-- Tina lets out a loud snort of a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: --in New York. In Manhattan. Here, you're safe. (spreads his arms; a knowing understatement) Nothing unusual ever happens here. She smiles at the sight of him, the helicopter behind him lawn gearing up to take off.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Really--you'll be okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be fine, dad. Go on.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Okay. Well...bye. He kisses her forehead. Takes his parka, heads out toward helicopter. Pauses to call to the Neighbor.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Will you keep an eye on things for us, Mr. Torkleson? The Neighbor's son answers immediately, almost gratefully

dialogues.speaker: SON
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: NEIGHBOR
dialogues.text: (scowls at his son) Yes...no problem. Jill regards Tina, who looks away sullenly. Jill smiles ruefully.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Use some of the money in the bread box to buy a bathrobe, huh?

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Whatever, mom. Jill looks at her. A perfunctory kiss--neither is comfort with it--and then Jill heads for the helicopter. The helicopter lifts. Jill sees Tina standing in the shad the porch. She looks very small and alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An C-130 transport with ski treads lands on a makeshift airstrip. Temporary shelters have been set up. The Rainbo Warrior is now mostly submerged. Jill and Keith emerge from the plane, make final adjustme their biohazard suits, heavy-duty coveralls with full hoo visor, hood slung back. Keith has a thin file folder. A young captain, TUCKER, peachfuzz mustache failing to ma  look older, meets them. He also wears a biohazard suit.

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER
dialogues.text: (greets each) Dr. Llewellyn! Dr. Llewellyn! I'm Tucker! Tucker takes Keith's arm, snaps something onto the sleeve

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER
dialogues.text: Radiation badge. If it goes red, consider yourself cured of cancer.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: And dead, of course.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: (as Tucker snaps a badge on her) But a healthy kind of dead.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: (points with the file) What the hell have you found here, anyway? Tucker leads them toward the fissure. Ahead, bio-suited w wheel large storage drums out of the fissure. seats a lid; Jill stops him, peers inside.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: This is peculiar soup...

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER
dialogues.text: Early analysis is pretty weird... It has a marked resemblance to amniotic fluid. We think.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Amniotic fluid?

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Like in a womb?

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER
dialogues.text: Uh-huh...well, not really... there're some complex compounds... and a heavy barbiturate presence. We think. One worker re- Jill scowls, her mind suddenly very far away as she cont this information.

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER
dialogues.text: I know one of you Doctors Llewellyn is a bio-chemist... Despite being addressed, Jill does not answer. Keith step

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: That would be the pretty one.

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER
dialogues.text: We have a lab set up if you'd like to... But Jill is already moving off with the worker wheeling t barrel.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: I think she'd like to. Hey, Jill! She turns. He hands her the file. lLeans to kiss her chee she's already reading the folder as she walks away. Keith glances at Tucker, shrugs. Tucker smiles. Pulls on hood, seals it. Keith does, too. Tucker gestures to follo slips into the fissure--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keith and Tucker clamber down ladders anchored to the gla deep into the fissure, into: A huge cavern, carved out of ice and earth, lit by a stri bare lights that stretch away in both directions. The wall opposite the fissure is imposing and strange, ma of crevices and finely textured stone, markedly different the ice wall and ceiling. A bio-suited workcrew pumps the red-black fluid into stor drums. Tucker leads Keith, slogging through shin-deep flu

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER
dialogues.text: The entire cavern was filled with this stuff-- Suddenly there is a LOW RUMBLE--a small TREMOR. Ice sifts from above. Lights flicker. Keith glances at Tucker.  10

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER
dialogues.text: An avalanche somewhere. Or the sea floor shifting. The blast that opened this up was some pretty mean shake-and-bake. Something beyond Tucker has drawn Keith's attention: appa it is a smaller cavern. Inside are weirdly regular rows o stalagmite and stalactites. Keith moves inside, examining Tucker stands outside.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: This is the strangest stalactite formation I've ever seen...

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER
dialogues.text: Those aren't stalactites. Keith gives him a puzzled look, starts to really examine "cavern'--

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER
dialogues.text: (enjoys the revelation) They're teeth. Keith's eyes widen--he suddenly sees what's been in front all along: he's inside a giant mouth. He scrambles out to beside Tucker.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: My God...my God. He takes in the mouth. Touches the strangely-textured ‘wa

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: And this isn't stone...is it? It's petrified or something--but this is skin. (he turns to Tucker) It's skin.

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER
dialogues.text: It's skin. We think. But it might as well be stone, for all the good we've done trying to get a tissue sample...we broke three diamond drill bits on it-- Keith clambers up, over the open mouth, caught up in the

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: This is incredible...the preservation is extraordinary... Mammoths and the like found frozen show much more decay. Even the  Alps ice man-- 10. He stops. Stares down the length of the body. The string of lights is more than a football field in len

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: How big is this...this..? Tucker climbs up beside him.

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER
dialogues.text: Two hundred forty-seven feet... There's also a tail, but how long that is we can't tell yet...

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Two hundred and forty-seven feet? (he looks again) Two hundred and forty-seven feet...so much for seismosaurus and ultrasaurus...It is a dinosaur, isn't it? Tucker shrugs--then nods, grinning.

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER
dialogues.text: We think. Another TREMOR, bigger this time. More ice rains down. Th lights flicker. Go out, plunging the cavern into DARKNESS

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER
dialogues.text: Shit...wait a sec... He snaps on a flashlight, illumining the two men, still s on the beast's muzzle.

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER
dialogues.text: (bellows an order) Nobody move 'til we get the lights back on. (to Keith) We don't need anyone tripping over some giant dinosaur nuts in the dark or something... (another order) And let's get the lights back on, shall we? Thank you! Behind the two men, unnoticed by them, there is MOVEMENT- 11  12 The monster's EYELID OPENS, ten feet across. A second, semi-transparent protective eyelid slides away- Revealing iris and slit pupil, glinting wetly-- The pupil dilates, focuses-- The lights come back on. The pupil contracts. The eye BLI 11.

dialogues.speaker: TUCKER
dialogues.text: (re: the lights) About time... Keith turns back to the beast. Its eye tracks his movemen Keith's own eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Good lord-- And then the earth shakes again as the beast's head moves Claws tear out of the earth-- One whole section of wall undulates--and we become aware the monster's tail is wrapped around the entire cavern-- Sections of the ladder tear loose. Climbers plunge to ear The mouth closes, then opens again. FIRE fills the cavern And there is a DISTINCTIVE ROAR, sharp and terrifying, un anything anyone has ever heard--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill peers into a microscope--and suddenly the building s She braces for it to pass. It doesn't. It gets worse. The door slams open. A Radio Man scrambles to a radio nea Jill. Fluorescent lights flicker, strobing the room.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: What's going on-- The whole room tips, upending cabinets and shelves. Jill pinned beneath a table.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO MAN
dialogues.text: Mayday! Mayday! This is Arctic Outpost--  13 A beam collapses, slamming into him, silencing him. The r still shaking. Jill tries to push the cabinet off of her, it is too heavy. She looks toward the window, and GASPS-- Despite her obscured view of the window in the half-colla wall, she sees: The two rows of huge, gleaming jagged teeth, moving past past and past for much longer than one would expect.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: My god... And then the building is jarred again, and the ceiling COLLAPSES, and the flickering lights flicker off. 12.

dialogues.speaker: TAKI ISLANDS, NORTHEAST OF JAPAN
dialogues.text: Heavy winds and rain: a HURRICANE. A small fishing villag battens down for the storm. Waves lash across the docks. One villager, JUNJI, looks out from his house. Moored boa bang against the docks. Villagers hurry to cover, past th stacked on the wharf. One boat's lines have come loose; it is in danger of gett swamped. JUNJI gasps: it is his boat. JUNJI'S WIFE appears in the doorway behind him, drawn by gasp. She sees the boat. Junji starts to leave the house- His wife stops him with a hand on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JUNJI'S WIFE
dialogues.text: (in Japanese) Don't go out there--you'll drown!

dialogues.speaker: JUNJI
dialogues.text: (in Japanese) Without my boat, I have no life! He stares at her, adamant. She nods, resigned--but gestur him to wait. Disappears into the house. Reappears with a bright yellow slicker. She helps Junji into it. He gives a kiss, then ducks into the storm. She watches him go. LIGHTNING scrabbles across the dark heavy clouds. Junji h  14 to his boat. Struggles to make the line fast. From out in the ocean, the village looks very small, very fragile. And then something rises out of the waves, block the village. Huge with jagged dorsal fins: Godzilla. On the docks, a SOUND rises above the storm: the DISTINCT ROAR. Junji looks up-- There is a FLASH OF LIGHTNING. Between Junji and the ligh the huge shape continues to rise-- Junji stares up in horror and shock. One huge, taloned fo crashes down, nearly on the small dock. And then the mons takes another step-- A dark shadow falls across Junji-- His wife watches, frozen with terror-- Junji falls back against the piling. The huge foot looms directly over him. He can see up, up, up the height of th body, the two arms, the serpentine neck. 13.

dialogues.speaker: JUNJI
dialogues.text: (in Japanese) It cannot be... (a certainty) Gojira... The foot descends--past him, miraculously sparing him. Other villagers see what's coming. Some run, some freeze, pray. Some race for the refuge of trees behind the villag The beast looms. One four-clawed hand reaches down-- --toward the villagers? Toward Junji? --Godzilla scoops up the entirety of the day's catch and tosses it into his gaping mouth, past enormous sharp teet His head turns toward the village. He moves, the earth sh beneath his tread. Junji's wife stares up as he nears-- Junji screams from the docks--

dialogues.speaker: JUNJI
dialogues.text: (in Japanese) Run! Run! --but she can't hear. Godzilla's foot comes down-- --crushing the house. Junjits eyes go hollow. He stares now, a mad witness.  15 Godzilla's tail drags across the village, causing more destruction. More villagers are buried beneath the wrecka But Godzilla pays them no heed. He reaches for the windswept forest behind the village, s huge furrow in the ground, uprooting an entire copse of t He raises it to his mouth--and two villagers who were hid shake loose, plummet to the ground. Godzilla gulps down t trees. He moves back toward the ocean--then pauses. Cranes his h back, looking up into the sky, searching for something-- The clouds blow apart briefly, revealing the night sky, e save for twinkling stars. The clouds close. Lightning cra GODZILLA ROARS and BREATHES FIRE. A warning. A challenge. And then he goes to all fours and dives into the sea, his bulk moving past Junji impossibly fast. Godzilla's 150-fo tail sweeps around, creating a huge wave-- The wave CRASHES across the island, hurling ships over do smashing through houses-- Junji clings to a piling for his life. The water sweeps b somehow, Junji holds on. He stares out at the sea--
Where the monster sinks down, disappearing into the viole storm-tossed ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ocean. Calm now. On a bluff above the ocean a road pa beneath a high, ugly wall, topped with barbed wire.

dialogues.speaker: ONE YEAR LATER
dialogues.text: A car veers off the road. Two men get out: AARON VAUGHT. Tall, graceful, eyes watchful behind wire-r glasses. He looks like a ski instructor who chucked it al become a librarian. MARTY KENOSHITA, enthusiastic, bordering on intense. He large trial case. Aaron steps up on the hood of the car, then to the roof, him a view across the top of the wall-- Beyond the barbed wire is not the expected prison. Instea there are manicured tea gardens, small cottages. A koi po beneath lovely waterfalls. All that betrays the illusion luxury hotel is the wall, surrounding the grounds on thre sides. The bluff is the fourth barrier. Marty scrambles up next to Aaron.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: There he is. (points) Staring at the ocean. Across the grounds, a figure sits.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Maybe he is crazy, like they say.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Yeah, and maybe not. If you wanted to hide someone, keep them quiet, this would be a good place--

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Marty, no paranoia tonight. (gestures) Loan me your coat. Marty frowns, but slips off his overcoat. 15. Aaron tosses it onto the wall, covering the barbed wire.

dialogues.speaker: HEY
dialogues.text: Aaron tosses his pack into the grounds. Leaps to the wall swings over. A beat; Marty heaves his case over, follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty and Aaron near the seated figure-- It is Junji--looking much older than can be accounted for 16  17 time passed. He seems unaware of their presence, eyes sta out to sea.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Mr. Tange? Junji Tange? No response. Aaron nods to Marty. Marty translates what A says into Japanese, nearly simultaneously.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: You're a hard man to find, Junji. We've been talking to survivors of the Taki Island Deluge for almost a year. Still no response. Marty adds something more in Japanese. his eyes, Aaron inquires ‘what?!

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: I said they all tell the same story: the worst hurricane in fifty years virtually washed away one of the chain. Aaron nods, steps closer to Junji. Marty still translates

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: But there are also stories of a man who saw a giant dragon. A dragon that breathed fire and made tidal waves. He waits. Nothing. He sighs-- --and then Junji speaks. Marty translates to English:

dialogues.speaker: JUNJI/MARTY
dialogues.text: A storm killed my wife. And I am a crazy man that no one believes. 16.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: (Marty translating) Every culture has myths about dragons. The Midgard Serpent, Quetzacoatl. The dragon that sleeps at the heart of the world... (beat) Only I don't think they're just stories.  18

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: (in Japanese) He even wrote a book about it. Before Aaron can stop him, Marty pulls out an oversized paperback, hands it to Junji. Aaron's photo is on the back cover. Junji looks from it t Aaron. Aaron, a little sheepish, strikes the same pose, s the same smile. Junji turns the book over. His eyes widen "THE WAKING DRAGON' by Aaron Vaught. The cover is an old print of a dragon; it vaguely resembles Godzilla. Junji hurriedly opens the book to a photo: an Aztec hieroglyph Quetzacoatl, again Godzilla-like. Junji flips through the book, becoming more excited with photograph, each reproduced drawing. He pauses-- CLOSE ON: an Assyrian carving of a dragon and a gryphon, around each other, locked in combat.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: (Marty translating) I believe in dragons, Junji. Junji looks up at him--then stands suddenly, and hurries carrying Aaron's book. Aaron and Marty follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron and Marty's car sits near the wall. Suddenly illumi high-powered flashlight beams. POLICEMEN swarm in. One cl to the roof, pulls Marty's coat off the wall. Displays it PIKE, wearing a scowl he was born with. He stands in fron two other AMERICAN AGENTS. All wear sharply-tailored blac suits and no-nonsense expressions. Pike rolls his neck, a characteristic tic, CRACKING it. Gestures for the police to move in-- 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simple in design: futon, low table, bath screened off. Junji looks around conspiratorially, loosens a floorboard

dialogues.speaker: JUNJI
dialogues.text: (in Japanese)  19 The doctors would take these if they knew-- He reaches into a space beneath the floor, digs out sheav paper. They spill toward Aaron, a flood of paper-- --drawings of Godzilla. Hundreds. Aaron and Marty sift th them, moving carefully to not step on them. Junji speaks excitedly; Marty listens, translate for Aaron:

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: He says he dreams of it. Remembers stories from his grandfather. About the people before people. Stories about-- Junji holds up a drawing. Painted on it are the three Jap Katakana characters for Godzilla.

dialogues.speaker: JUNJI
dialogues.text: Gojira. Marty whips out a PDA, writes down the name.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Have we ever indexed that name?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: No--wait, yes...In 1928, Atkinson translated the characters as...Godzilla-- He cuts himself off. A particular drawing has caught his He kneels beside it, staring. Aaron joins him. It is a painting. A _gryphon, curled into a fetal positio a mound beneath the earth. Godzilla breathing fire on it.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: The adversary? Aaron nods, picks it up-- Suddenly, two uniformed POLICEMAN burst into the cottage. move toward Aaron and Marty, who back away. Aaron folds t paper, slips it into his pocket. Junji, panicked, crawls, picking up his drawings, holding to his chest. A DOCTOR and several ATTENDANTS enter. 18.  20

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: (to Aaron) You are trespassing. And you have upset my patient. (in Japanese) (re: the drawings) He should not have these. The Attendants begin gathering up the drawings.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: You can't take those away-- The police escort Aaron and Marty roughly to the door--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, agent Pike stands, flanked by his agents. He fla his credentials at Aaron:

dialogues.speaker: PIKE
dialogues.text: Pike, National Security Council. You'll want to come with us. (to the police) Thank you, gentlemen. We'll take them from here.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: (to Marty) Did I call you paranoid? I apologize. The Attendants escort Junji away. Junji twists free. In b English, to Aaron:

dialogues.speaker: JUNII
dialogues.text: I am not a crazy who sees things-- (beat) I am crazy because of what I saw! Aaron regards him. The two men lock eyes.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I believe you. Junji looks relieved. His mouth trembles into a slight sm grateful for being believed. Aaron and Marty are escorted Junji sadly, resignedly, watches them go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sign reads: 'Now Entering/Now Leaving Traveller Utah We and Good-bye.' Along the bottom it proclaims: 'Visit the  21 Glistening Caves--Guaranteed 30 Degrees Cooler!" 19. A battered pickup with full gun racks rolls past. A BORDE COLLIE rides happily in the back on bales of hay.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVELLER, UTAH
dialogues.text: The pickup pulls up at a gas station/cafe, next to a sher 4X, Two ranch hands, JOHN and STU, get out. The Collie ju down. Sniffs the air, heads out toward the road.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Hold it a second. He pauses in front of the truck, lights up a Pall Mall.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (an old complaint) Goddammit, Stu, when you gonna quit? (Stu ignores him) And aren't you supposed to smoke after you eat? Stu takes a satisfying drag, grins.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: It's whatcha call an appetizer. The Collie suddenly STOPS. Makes a low GROWL toward the s Then it starts to HOWL--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grazing HORSES raise their heads, look around, nervous. VULTURES on a gnarled branch edge sideways, then swoop aw A crawling LIZARD stops, tilts its head. A COYOTE howls. SNAKE coils defensively. A MOUNTAIN LION leaps atop a rock outcropping, surveys th desert floor. Then, suddenly startled, it crouches down, up over its shoulder--

dialogues.speaker: THE SUN,
dialogues.text: huge, blazing, blindingly white. At its center, barely noticeable at first, is a tiny black dot...growing larger  22 approaches. Soon it ECLIPSES the sun...it is an ALIEN PRO hurtling toward us, taking us into DARKNESS-- The Coyote backs up several steps. The horses move closer together, rubbing past each other, spooked. The lizard sc away-- In the sky, the Alien Probe ROARS, a BALL OF FIRE now as through the air downward-- 20. The horses bolt. The Mountain Lion SNARLS--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quiet, remote lake. On the surface is the reflection of approaching Probe. It grows larger-- --and then the Alien Probe SLAMS into the lake; TONS of w are DISPLACED. The rest HISSES, BOILS, churning upwards i CURTAIN OF STEAM. Nearby treetops EXPLODE INTO FLAME--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wind-blown snow washes across the familiar icy landscape. SOLDIER trudges toward one of a cluster of shacks that si the edge of the gaping crevice of Godzilla's womb. Suddenly a low RUMBLE builds to a deep, rending GRINDING The Soldier turns: in the distance a PILLAR OF LIGHT shoo toward the sky. The light emerges from a huge CRACK in the ice. A GLOWING CHAMBER pushes up, cutting through the ice. It is dome-sh a series of huge bubbles arranged in the regular/irregula pattern of a Mandlebrot equation. The Soldier backs away from it...turns and RUNS toward a building--so fast he slips, falls hard on the ice. He get pulls open the door--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Soldier flips on the radio, grabs the mic.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Nome, this is Outpost 42--come in! Jesus, come in--  23 The radio emits a HIGH-PITCHED SQUEAL. He clicks the dial SQUEAL covers all channels--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the cafe window, the corner-mounted television flips t static. We hear the same HIGH-PITCHED SQUEAL. Outside, the Collie darts between John's legs, under the Cigarette smoke drifts toward John; he waves at it.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Haven't you ever heard of second- hand smoke? 21.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Yeah, you ever hear of a second- hand ass-kicking? That's when I think about hitting you so hard, you feel it-- WHACK! Suddenly, for no apparent reason, John is knocked Stu stares.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Huh. Guess I wasn't kidding.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: What the hell hit me? Stu looks, points: a mangled frog, dazed, lies beside Joh sTU Someone shot a frog at you. BANG! Another frog bounces off the roof of the truck. Ano one SLAPS down onto the street.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Shit--they're shootin' frogs at both of us! And then comes the DELUGE: Rain, frogs and fish pour down the darkened skies. They BANG off the corrugated tin roof of the cafe. The 4X siren light bar SHATTERS. Stu and John leap into the pick  24 The Sheriff exits the cafe, hand on gun. A roly-poly WAIT follows. They stare as: Frogs and fish plummet, breaking windshields. Electricity CRACKLES as telephone wires are snapped. Beneath the pick frightened Collie looks out at the madness.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Like in the bible...A plague is being visited on us. It's a sign of the millennium... On a store porch, NELSON FLEER appears. The sign above advertises: Wilderness Guide/Cave Diving/ Prospecting/Nel Fleer, Prop. A tall, athletic man, Fleer carries a dive t one hand, a wrench in the other. The rain of frogs and fishes slowly abates. The Sheriff m into the street, hand still on his gun, peering warily up sky, and stepping gingerly. Fish gasp and flop. Some frog twitch, the less mangled ones try to hop.

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: Damn. I hate weird shit. 22. He sees a dead frog on the rail. Flicks it; it flops to t ground. A final glance at the sky, then Fleer ducks insid

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: (starts to pray) Oh, God. Grant us strength to overcome our sins that displeased you...

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: (a sigh) Grant us strength to clean this mess up. A SQUISH as he missteps. He lifts his leg to check the bo of his shoe, curses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron and Marty wait in the plush lounge, uncomfortable. Special Agent Pike enters, extends a thick file.

dialogues.speaker: PIKE
dialogues.text: Here. You're to familiarize  25 yourself with these materials. Puzzled, Aaron takes the file. On the front is a logo: an armored gauntlet holding a sword. Emblazoned with the wor GEORGE PROJECT. Stamped TOP SECRET. Aaron opens the folder. His eyes widen. Marty leans in, o his shoulder-- The first page is a photo of Godzilla's head as he was fo half-buried in ice. A bio-suited figure gives it scale. A flips back to the cover.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: The St. George Project? Grinning, Pike tilts his head, CRACKS his neck.

dialogues.speaker: PIKE
dialogues.text: Mr. Vaught, your government would like to offer you a job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imbedded in a conference table is the gauntlet-and-sword the St. George Project. Aaron's book 'The Waking Dragon' tossed, lands on the logo.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: This is unacceptable. It's... it's...an insult to the work that we've done. 23.

dialogues.speaker: HEADQUARTERS, THE ST. GEORGE PROJECT
dialogues.text: ADMIRAL TIMOTHY BENEDEK sits at the head of the table. Hi carved laugh lines contrast with his razor cut bearing.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: Concerns have been raised about the lack of results. I cut a deal to keep your funding. ED, a scientist wearing trademark white T-shirt, leans ba the table, frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: (spits out the word) Politics.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: Your feelings, Dr. Llewellyn? At the far end of the table, a FIGURE sits in shadow, hid from view. The FIGURE stands into the light-- --and we reveal not Keith Llewellyn, as expected, but his Jill. The time passed has not diminished the passion in h but events have darkened it, given it a steely edge.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: If he's being groomed for my job, I want to know it.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: Vaught will start in an advisory role. If that gets results, there won't be need for any further changes. Jill considers this.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: I'll think about it.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: Think fast--he's on his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pike puts his palm on a palm-lock, peers into a retina sc Aaron and Marty glance at each other nervously. Door locks UNCLAMP. Pike steps through--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron and Marty follow Pike into the situation room. Glas walls surround a combination of mission control and a sci lab. Marty looks out through the glass, gasps-- The glass building sits inside a larger structure which c a huge WATER-FILLED TANK, stretching off into the distanc size of a small lake. Pike sees them looking at it, expla

dialogues.speaker: PIKE
dialogues.text: 26  To store the beastie--if we ever find it. (grins) Dr. Llewellyn calls it the dissection tank-- At the far end of the room, Jill bursts through a door, a Benedek follows her.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: The man has drawn some correct conclusions--

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: He's made lucky guesses. Aaron Vaught is no scientist. He's a folklorist who believes in the lost continent of Atlantis. He's a crackpot.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: He's a popular crackpot. The President has read that book-- Jill speaks to Benedek, oblivious to Aaron's presence:

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Listen. Vaught wants to...to collect this thing. To index it. To write books about it and earn lecture fees talking about it and pose for goddamn photos with it. (fierce) I just want to kill it. So you see, there is a conflict.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Hi. (Jill glances at him) I'm Aaron Vaught. Maybe you've read my book..? Jill regards him. Locks eyes with Benedek. Adamant: 25.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: That creature killed dozens of people--including my husband. Our mission stays the same. We find it-- and then we kill it.  28 This point is not negotiable. Benedek nods.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: Your mission hasn't changed. A VIDEOPHONE near Ed chimes. He answers it.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: I think it's for you. He turns the phone to Jill. ON SCREEN: A MILITARY POLICE OFFICER, wearing a white MP helmet and a scowl. Jill rolls her eyes. She knows what its about.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Tina. (to the phone) I'm on my way. She exits, pushing past Aaron. He watches her go, then Be hands him the copy of his book.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: Here. The President asked if you'd sign this for him..? Aaron takes the book, a little shell-shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standard issue office, standard issue desks, standard iss leads Jill through the bullpen.

dialogues.speaker: MP
dialogues.text: She was arrested in the motor pool. Trying to hot-wire a jeep. TINA sits in a chair beside a desk.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: I've got to remember: red wire to green wire. She is sixteen now, grunge clothes, hair buzz-cut on one But the camouflage doesn't quite hide the bright, attract young woman she really is.

dialogues.speaker: MP
dialogues.text: If she continues to be... unmanageable, you and she will be expelled from base housing.  26.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: I think that's her plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill winds the car through clone-identical base housing.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: There is nothing here for me, mom. Just a bunch of grunts and eggheads. No offense.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: (icy) None taken.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: You should let me go live with Aunt Julia--

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: I'm not having this argument again. This is where my job is. Ergo, this is where you are.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: I'm sick of this place! I'm sick of army brats and the MPs and the PX...and I'm sick of green. There isn't even a mall anywhere nearby...

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Oh, as though you're going to go hang at a mall.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: (smiles) Well...okay. Right on that. She regards Jill, considering something. Proceeds warily.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: But...I'm not just thinking of me. I'm really not. I'm...I'm worried about you, mom. Jill glances at her. This is of real concern to Tina.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: I think you need to get out of this place, too. I don't think its good for you. 29  30 She gauges Jill's reaction. So far, so good. Takes a deep breath, plunges ahead: 27.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Ever since Dad died, you've...you changed, okay? Maybe we didn't always get along, but--

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Do not pursue this, Tina. And do not blame our difficulties on...on that.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: I'm not! Jeez, you can't even talk about it. Obviously a vulnerable spot for Jill. She looks away. A l silence in the car. They both stare out the front windshi Tears well up in Tina's eyes. Jill pulls the car up into the driveway of their house. T lets out a loud sob, surprising Jill, and bolts from the Jill climbs out quickly, calls after her--

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Tina! Tina-- Tina pauses on the porch-- And then Jill's BEEPER SHRIEKS. She checks it. Tina waits on the porch, arms folded.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: I've got to go. She climbs back in the car, backs out of the drive.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Quell surprise. The car's headlights sweep across Tina, and then she is a the darkened porch.

dialogues.speaker: TEN MILES NORTHWEST OF TRAVELLER, UTAH
dialogues.text: 31 The Alien Probe descends into frame, its smooth metal-chr surface slicing easily through the water. Ahead is a subm CAVE OPENING. We follow as the Probe is swallowed into da

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dim light filters down. Water laps against an underground shore. The Alien Probe rises though the murky depths-- 28. --and breaks the surface of the water. Several BATS, star fly past, circling the cavern. ANGLE - CEILING, where HUNDREDS and HUNDREDS of BATS hang crawling over each other, emitting an occasional squeak a flutter. In the water, the Alien Probe ROTATES, as if targeting th Suddenly the Probe ERUPTS--silvery cables EXPLODE out fro probe in all directions. A bat is ensnared in by a cable. The bat struggles, wings flailing, SCREECHING. There is the sound of SEARING FLESH Across the cavern, another bat is taken. Then another. SCREECHING and FLAPPING, the bats fly, panicked. One bat toward light at the ceiling, soaring toward freedom-- It is SNARED by a cable. More bats are taken, and more, building up to-- ANGLE - THE CAVERN, completely covered, overrun by the li chrome cables, a complex three-dimensional web. The bats absorbed by the cables, their masses sucked toward the ce the web-- --where something grows. Roughly five feet tall, we can j begin to see bat-like features--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A narrow crevice on the face of a cliff, high above the devastated lake. Something--many somethings--sail out into the sky, twelve wingspans just clearing the opening. Giant horrors, mutat from bats by the Alien Probe--  32 The PROBE-BATS sweep out across the land, hunting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A transport plane drops out of dense clouds, banks in a l slow curve over the remains of Godzilla's womb site--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out the windows the horizon tilts as the plane banks. Aar Marty, Jill and Ed on board. Aaron cranes to see--approac below them are the irregular large spheres of the new cav

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: That's the source of the radio burst?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: (nods) Worldwide interference, narrowing down to a single directional band--

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: (sees it) My God. That whole structure wasn't there before--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The transport plane disappears into low clouds--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wind blows loose snow. Silhouettes of Aaron and Marty app wearing heavy military parkas. They follow Jill, ahead of to the edge of Godzilla's womb. Jill pauses, looks down. Her eyes are distant, rememberin this is where her husband died. Aaron and Marty wait. Aar shivers, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I hate cold weather. He's unknowingly struck a nerve. Jill shoots a look at hi  33

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: My apologies for your discomfort, Mr. Vaught. We can return you to a warmer clime, if you like. She doesn't wait for an answer, climbs down into the womb

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group is escorted by a burly French SCIENTIST. Ahead, ladders have been strung up toward a dark crevice.

dialogues.speaker: SCIENTIST
dialogues.text: Entrance to the new cavern is above that outcropping, there-- Jill spots something, kneels. A rivulet of red/black amni fluid oozes from of a nearby fissure. Army personnel coll in large yellow canisters.

dialogues.speaker: SCIENTIST
dialogues.text: It started flowing at the same time the new cavern appeared.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: What is it? 30.

dialogues.speaker: SCIENTIST
dialogues.text: Same stuff the original team found. Like amniotic fluid--

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Send it south for testing. I want to know if it is the same. She looks over, notices Aaron staring at a crumpled, fold paper: Junji's drawing. He looks from it to the cavern.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: (to himself) ...the adversary?

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Aaron? Will you share with the rest of the class?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Hm? Oh...uh...it's common in mythology for  (shrugs; forges ahead) For the great dragons to have opponents...adversaries. Sometimes it's a sun-king, sometimes another monster-- (for instance) In the Bible, Leviathan and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behemoth--

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Right. So we figure, if Godzilla exists--

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: You've given it a name?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: We found out its name. (beat) So--if Godzilla exists...then where is its adversary? Marty's eyes drift upward, over to the dark entrance of t cavern. Jill rolls her eyes, grabs a biohazard suit--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill pulls herself up over a final rise--and her eyes wid The entrance of the newly-discovered 'cave' is almost per round. Inside, the walls are finely-textured and greenish colored, similar to Godzilla's skin. 31. Aaron and Marty, wearing biohazard suits, climb up, gawk structure. Jill pulls her protective hood on, steps forwa There's a dark, flaky substance around the edge of the en She shines her flashlight onto it, frowns

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Organic matter, dehydrated, petrified--

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: A doorway, maybe? Or what's left of one. An organic doorway. Aaron takes her flashlight, pushes past, into the cavern. raises an eyebrow at him, follows. 34

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dim, otherworldly. Aaron shines the light. The walls are and blue, delicate lines running throughout like roots or veins-- but too symmetrical to be natural. Very weird.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: (hushed) This entire structure seems organic-- (an insight) Hey...remember Junji's grandfather's stories? The "people before people?!

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Right--

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Imagine a civilization without mechanical technology...but they do have an organic technology. Bio-constructs, genetic engineering--

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah! There wouldn't be any relics or evidence of it--it would all decay--

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Except this place. This place is...special, somehow. Jill stares at them. Jill takes

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: You don't go in for empiricism at all, do you? 32.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: What? the flashlight back, starts deeper into the cavern.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: You spout stuff like that, huge leaps of logic, a total guess, and in your mind, it's already true. 35

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not just a 'guess.' You extrapolate from known--

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: You guess. Admit it.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: You search for the underlying patterns--

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: You guess. She turns her back on him, heads deeper into the cavern. grins at her.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I'm a good guesser

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty, breathing a little hard, follows behind Jill and A He stumbles. Inside his protective hood, HIS VISOR IS FOG UP. He tries to rub it through the material, can't. Ahead, he hears Jill and Aaron gasp.

dialogues.speaker: AARON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Wow... Marty hurries forward, emerging out into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bizarre sight. Rows of round, cauliflower-shaped object down from the ceiling a few feet over their heads. Also g in color, shot through with a complex blue structure. Marty breathes out hard through his nose. The visor defog briefly--then immediately re-fogs

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: So, Vaught...where are we now? Aaron considers. Suddenly we CUT TO: 33. 36  37

dialogues.speaker: LOOKING DOWN,
dialogues.text: on Jill, Aaron and Marty. It's a surveillance-type angle, sudden shift in perspective creating the feeling that som is watching them.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I wonder...this structure appears-- then it signals us to let us know its here... (chasing an idea) Godzilla was discovered accidentally...maybe prematurely?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: We were supposed to find this first... Marty gives up--he wants to see. He pulls up his hood bri to wipe the visor-- Suddenly, shockingly we SHOOT DOWN TOWARD MARTY--

dialogues.speaker: INTO A MICROCOSMIC LANDSCAPE,
dialogues.text: We are the P.O.V. of whatever was watching them. When Mar lifted his hood, it attacked. We--and it--move through th bizarre, truly alien world. Hair follicles--Marty's eyelash--loom above, big as trees Ahead is the colorful, beautiful cornea-- MOVE IN CLOSER STILL, into the realm of the electron micr The cornea is a landscape of individual cells-- --and now we see the thing, as it moves ahead, into frame is an ALIEN OBJECT, microscopic in size, of course, but i world looming large as a jetliner-- It is spiral shaped, shiny-- It could be an organism, or a machine-- The alien object suddenly DIVES DOWN, twisting, burrowing through the microfilement of a cell, INTO MARTY'S EYE, pa retina, plunges into the optic nerve--

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: as Marty lowers the flap of his hood. The foray into the microcosmic world has lasted just a few seconds. Marty dr one knee, blinking.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: You okay?  38

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: (nods he's all right) Something in my eye.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: So if we find this before Godzilla-- this could be here to give us information about Godzilla.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: So what you're saying is...This is the owner's manual?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Well, that makes it sound a little silly...but, yeah. Jill shakes her head. Starts back up the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Keep guessing, Aaron...that's you're here for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron, Jill and Marty climb out. Jill pauses, surveys the strange domes of the new structure. Marty pulls a canteen his belt, begins to drink.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: We were definitely brought here. The question still is, why? She looks at Aaron for an answer. He has none. She heads toward the outpost structures. Aaron turns to follow. Mar still drinking--

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Marty--c'mon, get a move on. Marty has drained the canteen. He lets the empty canteen to the ground. Wipes his mouth, licks his lips--he's stil thirsty.

dialogues.speaker: QUINCY RANCH, OUTSIDE TRAVELLER, UTAH
dialogues.text: 39 The BUZZING of FLIES. At the edge of a stream, several co dead, mutilated. A single calf BLEATS, trembling, standin to the remains of its mother. A VULTURE flutters down, gnaws at a nearby corpse. The calf BLEATS again. 35. In the brush nearby, we become aware of a MOUNTAIN LION, crouched, stalking forward--nine feet and three hundred p of muscle. It is focused on-- The calf. Unaware, it lets out another BLEAT. The Mountain Lion tenses, ready to spring-- Suddenly a DARK SHAPE sweeps down, attacks the Lion: one PROBE-BATS. The Lion SNARLS and ROARS. The predator has b prey, fighting for its life-- The Vulture flaps its wings, trying to lift off--a Probe- streaks by and the Vulture is gone-- Another Probe-bat dives toward the Mountain Lion, razored bared in its muzzle-- The Lion screams, leaps, brings the Probe-bat down. But t more attack, claws slashing the flank of the big cat-- More bats, and the Lion is overcome. Several Probe-bats l onto it, lift it into the air. They MERGE with it, talons the probe-bats melting into the body of the Mountain Lion carry it up, across the stream, the cat's BLOOD running f wounds into the water. At the water's edge, still trembling, is the calf. It let a final BLEAT. The stream flows past, the Mountain Lion's staining it red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunlight glares off still water. Three small fishing boat Larry, Moe, and Curly, Seattle registry--swelter in the h nets winched up on their booms.

dialogues.speaker: PACIFIC OCEAN
dialogues.text: The engine of the Curly cranks over, will not catch. Blac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 40 smoke pours from the open engine compartment. The CAPTAIN the fleet gestures to cut it.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: My dear old ex-wife Sally musta struck some kinda deal with God to screw me so royal...

dialogues.speaker: CREWMAN
dialogues.text: Captain! (points northwest) What's that? The Captain looks northwest. Squints. A SECOND CREWMAN wears a pair of binoculars around his ne The Captain jerks him over, puts the binocs to his eyes. 36. P.O.V., THE CAPTAIN - THROUGH BINOCULARS: on the horizon, sea has turned to molten silver, sunlight glinting off of something, a million bright sparkles, racing toward them. The Captain's mouth drops open. He lowers the binocs.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: (a near-whisper) ..-nets in... (finds his voice)

dialogues.speaker: NETS IN
dialogues.text: He leaps to the winch, starts cranking down the net. Look to the horizon-- The sparkles draw closer-- Shouts from the boat crews as they realize what it is-- --FISH, MILLIONS OF THEM, all swimming towards the southe churning through the water, turning it a glittering silve ichthyic stampede. The boats have nets in the water as the living wave hits- UNDERWATER, all sizes, all varieties of fish SLAM into th Predator and prey, small and large, they are pressed tigh more fish coming from behind. The net tears in places; so fish burst through-- Above, the nets go taught, filling quickly. The boats are buffeted. They jerk around, yanked along by the momentum onslaught of fish, tipping to netside.  41

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Haul, men! She don't got no pull with the good Lord after all! The crews, WHOOPING and HOLLERING, haul the nets up, spil tides of fish--tuna, yellowtail, snapper, some dolphins-- the decks. More fish leap aboard of their own volition, t desperately to outrace something. Nets still in the water pull the boats along, the filamen screamingly taut-- Larry's net rips open, the boat rocking back. On the Curl winch creaks, groans--SNAPS OFF, takes a crewman over the He SCREAMS as racing bodies slam into him, the torrent of overwhelming him, carrying him under and away-- --and then, just as quickly as it began... ...the onslaught is over. The fish are past, disappearing the southeast. The waters empty, going from silver to blu The Moe's crew pulls in a last netfull of fish. The Larry nets hang limp. The decks of all three boats are piled hi with flopping, squirming fish.
And then the Crewman spots something to the northwest, th direction the fish came from--

dialogues.speaker: CREWMAN
dialogues.text: Captain-- (he points) More fish? The Captain looks-- Something else is coming at them, moving fast just beneat surface. The water is humped, cresting over the huge shap Godzilla, doing forty knots.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND CREWMAN
dialogues.text: Tidal wave! It's a tidal wave! Other crewmen see it, pointing, shouting--

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Get the engines started! Let's get out of here! He sees the open engine compartment, tools and parts scat  42 around. Realizes there's no escape--

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: (a scream to the heavens)

dialogues.speaker: SALLY, YOU BITCH
dialogues.text: --THE CREST OF WATER HITS the fleet, tossing the little b capsizing the Moe immediately, slamming the Larry and Cur together almost comically. Crewmen go overboard as planks way and sea water fountains up through the deck. The wake is just as turbulent. Men disappear beneath the water. The Larry goes belly-up. Curly lists sixty-degrees And the fish slide from the deck, back into the water, an swim for it, disappearing into the black depths...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A COMM OFFICER hands Jill a headset. Aaron right behind h but pointedly ignored. Marty stands at a water cooler, fi and drinking a cup of water incessantly.

dialogues.speaker: COMM OFFICER
dialogues.text: I've got the U.S.S. Idaho, part of the rescue team--

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Yes...yes...how many ships? 38.

dialogues.speaker: COMM OFFICER
dialogues.text: We've got video-- A VIDEO SCREEN flashes to life, showing the rescue ship communications room. A young LIEUTENANT speaks INTO CAMER

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: (filtered) --Must've been at least three boats to begin with, I'd guess. Just pieces left now.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Any eyewitnesses?

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: 43 (filtered) Yeah, a couple, ‘cept they don't make any sense-- Suddenly the audio drops out. The Lieutenant is still on screen, his lips moving, but no sound.

dialogues.speaker: COMM OFFICER
dialogues.text: We've lost audio. (beat) I can patch in through the ham. There'll be a delay--

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Do it. The Comm Officer is already doing it. Switches are flippe dials turned--and the audio is back. (With the radio audio delayed, the Lieutenant's lips don' our tribute to dubbed Godzilla films of years past.)

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: (filtered) --reported a tidal wave. Another described it as a creature, like a dragon. ‘It came up from beneath us,' he said... The audio CRACKLES. Jill looks at Aaron. Could it be?

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: (filtered) ...too big to be a whale--some say it had arms and legs. Right now we're not sure just what we're dealing with... The audio fades out. The Comm Officer works to get it bac

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Godzilla. 39.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: It has to be. Marty suddenly thinks of something he needs to say. He ta step toward Aaron and Jill-- --and COLLAPSES against the water cooler, knocks it over. water bottle bounces, clatters on the floor--completely e  44

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Marty! (rushes to him) Get a doctor, quick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty is wheeled in, a MEDIC examining him. A NURSE appli chemical heat pads to Marty's hands and feet.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: I just need a glass of water...

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Can we get him to better facilities?

dialogues.speaker: MEDIC
dialogues.text: Don't worry. We'll handle it. The Nurse tugs away Marty's jacket-- Gasps, drops the jacket. Marty's shoulders are swollen, his collarbones distended grotesquely. The Medic turns, looks. The bones in Marty's shoulders MO with a life of their own. THEY SHIFT, repositioning thems under Marty's skin. The Medic's eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: MEDIC
dialogues.text: Holy Christ. (back to business) Once he's stabilized, uh, let's get him to better facilities--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty, on a stretcher, is loaded into the cargo bay of a Aaron helps. Behind Marty are yellow canisters--fluid fro Godzilla's womb.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: So...you think it's really Godzilla? (Aaron nods) Man...I wish I could see it. 40.  45 Aaron clasps his hand.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: If I meet him, I'll tell 'em you said 'hi.' Marty manages a weak smile.

dialogues.speaker: MEDIC
dialogues.text: (to Aaron) Exit the craft, sir. Aaron hops down from the cargo bay. Looks in-- CLOSE ON - Marty, as the cargo door SLIDES SHUT. The engi WHINE as they start up. Jill steps up next to Aaron, puts a hand on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: It's been sighted again. A direction's been established, and they're predicting a destination--

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Where? Jill turns her head away from the engines. She has to sho over the noise:

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: San Francisco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AERIAL VIEW of cruise ship, majestic, cutting across the wake spread out behind it. Deck crowded with tourists. A HUGE, SHADOWY SHAPE overtakes the liner, passes BENEATH it: Godzilla. The liner is rocked by the monster's passage.

dialogues.speaker: FORT POINT, SAN FRANCISCO
dialogues.text: The Golden Gate Bridge. Beneath it sits Fort Point. Heavy artillery is being deployed. A state of siege. A jeep pul up. Jill and Aaron, still dressed for the Arctic, hop out  41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The high-tech command post. Large view screens dominate t room. Admiral Benedek is there, and so is Pike. Jill hurr in, Aaron in her wake.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: What's its latest position?

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: It's twenty miles from the battle group. They'll have it in visual range soon.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Godzilla.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: (off Benedek's look) That's what he's calling it.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: (nods) Godzilla.

dialogues.speaker: PIKE
dialogues.text: Why don't you two sit over there? Jill and Aaron look at the chairs, glance at each other.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: I'll stand.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: (re: the battle group) Do you think that's enough firepower? ON SCREEN: An aerial view of the Pacific Ocean. A battle dots the water--two destroyers, two frigates, two attack two blue ridge class vessels, two Avenger class warfare s Attack helicopters circle the ships.

dialogues.speaker: PIKE
dialogues.text: Don't worry. It'll do the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Choppers rise from the deck of a ship. Guns are uncovered Trained on targets. Rocket launchers are locked into posi 46  47 The submarines Madison and Lafayette plow through the wav

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LIEUTENANT approaches the COMMANDER, who surveys the oc with binoculars. 42.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: Sir, the choppers have spotted it.

dialogues.speaker: OPS OFFICER
dialogues.text: Message from the Saratoga--they've spotted it! ON SCREEN: the view shifts, shows the oncoming monster. A shape beneath the water, moving fast. Jill and Aaron look, share almost the same reaction: part amazement, part fear, part satisfaction. They've both wai long time...but Jill's fists are clenched. Her eyes narro

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: The commander may fire at his discretion.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: (softly, quoting) ‘Now shall hard edge, hand and blade, do battle for the hoard.'

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: From Beowulf. His speech before he battles the dragon.

dialogues.speaker: PIKE
dialogues.text: Did he win?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Yes...but it cost him his army and his life.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: (dryly)  Inspirational. ON SCREEN: POV of a helicopter pilot as his craft skims o water--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As pilot and co-pilot scan the ocean. They spot-- Godzilla's dorsals rise and fall, breaking the surface.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Target locked. 43.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: They've acquired the target.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER
dialogues.text: Fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the pilot FIRES--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Missiles streak away from the helicopter, toward the movi shape-- They find their targets. Plumes of water rise up-- Another barrage is fired. More explosions. The shape is gone.

dialogues.speaker: ATTACK PILOT
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch--did we get it?

dialogues.speaker: ATTACK CO-PILOT
dialogues.text: I think we sank it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Godzilla ERUPTS from the water, directly in the helicopte path-- 48

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evasive! Evasive! Godzilla BREATHES FIRE-- The flames engulf the cockpit. The helicopter explodes.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER
dialogues.text: What...the hell...was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Second Attack Helicopter banks away. Godzilla watches It banks to attack-- Godzilla dives forward, his arm sweeping up-- He grabs the helicopter out of the sky. Hurls it away. It skips across the ocean and EXPLODES.
Godzilla ROARS...and keeps coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is quiet. All are stunned at what just happened.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: My God...

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: (hushed) What's that thing made of?

dialogues.speaker: PIKE
dialogues.text: Let's open him up and find out.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: Order the Madison and the Lafayette to engage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Madison and Lafayette submerge. The Avenger-class ships open fire. Missiles arc across th 49 rain down on Godzilla. EXPLOSIONS all along his back. Go submerges again.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The Madison moves silently through the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bridge. The crew is crisp, calm.

dialogues.speaker: FIRE CONTROL
dialogues.text: We have a firing solution, sir.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Fire.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Torpedoes away. They lock onto Godzilla, gaining from beh --IMPACT! The torpedoes DETONATE, EXPLODE on his back fin A beat. And then-- Godzilla's head comes around slowly. His eyes lock on the He scowls even more than usual. He's pissed. He twists, reverses direction. Charges straight at the su 45.

dialogues.speaker: SONAR
dialogues.text: Captain! It's coming at us!

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Surface! BLOW THE BALLAST TANKS!

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: --as the Madison's ballast tanks evacuate. The sub rises, angled for the surface-- --Godzilla passes through the space the sub occupied seco before, a bull just missing a matador-- 50

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Thank the lord...

dialogues.speaker: SONAR
dialogues.text: (panicked) Captain! There's something above us! There's no more time for prayer--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --the Madison SURFACES, bursting from the water-- --and rams the second destroyer at midships. A colossal w washes across the bridge of the Sarasota. The second dest is capsized.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The Lafayette is between Godzilla and the surface. As he past, he almost nonchalantly reaches out-- His massive claws tear the Lafayette's hull open--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the claws rip through the hull, water spilling in. The scramble for emergency stations--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Godzilla surfaces, almost seems to regard the havoc he's with pride. HE BREATHES FIRE. A TONGUE OF FLAME, nearly w hot, stabs out at the capsized destroyer, hitting it mids 46. The hull MELTS. The EXPLOSION is spectacular. His path cl Godzilla continues on his way, leaving behind the battle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill, Benedek, Pike stare at the screen. Aaron moves on s legs to the chair he was offered earlier. 51  52

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: It really does breathe fire...

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: (a hoarse whisper) Contact Air-Sea rescue...let's get as many of those men back as we can... Pike stares at the monitor... --and at Godzilla, still headed for San Francisco.

dialogues.speaker: PIKE
dialogues.text: It's fifty miles from the San Francisco...it'll be here in an hour. (ominously) Our options are limited.

dialogues.speaker: POINT
dialogues.text: Aaron peers at one of the monitors, at a still frame of G breathing fire. Behind him, Jill, Benedek and Pike are in conference with several uniformed officials. Jill looks

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: Goddammit, Pike--If we go nuclear, with the winds and currents, even our smallest yield device could irradiate the coast--

dialogues.speaker: PIKE
dialogues.text: And that thing would be dead. Any additional loss of life or property would be acceptable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: troubled--she almost agrees with Pike.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: You know, he's not really breathing fire. They look over at him. He indicates the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: See...the flame starts a couple of meters from Godzilla's mouth... 47.  The others join him, peer at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: It looks like you're right. So?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: He's exhaling something so hot its actually ionizing the oxygen molecules...

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Again...So? Aaron is distracted, an idea trying to break through.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Given Godzilla's size and speed, the amount of energy he expends, he must have a very different metabolism from most large creatures. A body chemistry that would let him eat relatively little... and breathe superheated steam

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (figures it out) Like a nuclear reactor. A biological fusion reactor.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: You've got to be kidding.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: No, that's it. I'll bet a year's royalties from my book that some of that wreckage is radioactive. The Ops Officer looks up from her post, startled.

dialogues.speaker: OPS OFFICER
dialogues.text: That's right. The rescue teams have reported higher-than-normal radiation counts. Aaron smiles, nodding.

dialogues.speaker: PIKE
dialogues.text: Well, that's just fascinating, Vaught. Aaron's satisfied smile disappears.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Listen--somehow, Godzilla was in that womb for a long time. Something must've functioned like control rods...  And then the light goes on Jill's eyes. 48.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: The fluid.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: (gets her meaning) Yes...

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: We always assumed the fluid was used for life support. But what if it's not? What if it's actually... (searches for a term)

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: An atomic tranquilizer.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Well, that makes it sound a little silly...but, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: There were barrels of that stuff on the transport with us...

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: If we can administer it--

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Maybe even overdose him--

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: How do we administer it? They've left the others in the room in the dust.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: It's got to be transdermal...he must have absorbed it directly through his skin...

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: 54  Wait a second. Who's guessing now? He was floating in that stuff...Maybe he has to breath it for it to be effective--

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: (shakes her head) Transdermal. I'll bet you that year's royalties double or nothing.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: One problem, people. The delivery system. Are you going to be out there with a hose when Godzilla comes swimming into the Bay? Jill gets a faraway look in her eye.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: If it comes to that...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: There is an above surface SPLASH--then something is falli us in a trail of bubbles. It slows. Stops. A depth charge. One of a line, extending across an underw channel. Closing it off. WE SURFACE--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Medfly spraying helicopters skim above the water. Behind the Golden Gate Bridge spans the mouth of the bay. It is with abandoned cars and trucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A truck towing an artillery cannon shoves its way through cars, moving the cannon into place. Aaron watches the sol prepare it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON A TV SCREEN: the Golden Gate Bridge, artillery in plac backdrop to a remote stand-up news report. 55  56

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: (filtered) The reasons for all the activity are still unknown. There's speculation that a nuclear powered sub has become disabled in the Bay. But again--that's just rumor... Jill and Benedek watch the report. The Reporter is replac video of people being evacuated by National Guardsmen.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Communities surrounding the Golden Gate Bridge and the Bay have been ordered evacuated... 50.

dialogues.speaker: OPS OFFICER
dialogues.text: They've spotted him! She taps some buttons. On the main screen, a satellite im appears: San Francisco Bay, the Golden Gate Bridge...and Godzilla, heading for it.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: Start spraying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopters begin spraying, coating the water with RE AMNIOTIC FLUID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pike watches the monitor. Cracks his neck.

dialogues.speaker: PIKE
dialogues.text: C'mon, you bastard...where are the depth charges? He should be hitting them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water ERUPTS as a charge goes off. Then another. Another. A chain of explosions, nearing the  bridge.

dialogues.speaker: PIKE
dialogues.text: That's better. Jill speaks into a mic.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Aaron, you ought to get out of there.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: (into radio) On my way. But he pauses--past the spraying helicopters, he can see explosions from the depth charges. Godzilla is coming.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: (filtered) Any more inspirational words? 51.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: (thinks) "It is not strength that always wins/For wit doth strength excel.' From the Ballad of the Dragon of Wantley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill and Benedek exchange a glance.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Not bad...

dialogues.speaker: OPS OFFICER
dialogues.text: The depth charges are driving him to the surface!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 57  58 More charges detonate in sequence, nearing the area the helicopters are spraying. Godzilla breaks the surfaces with a ROAR.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Oh, man. No way. He banks his helicopter. Godzilla is almost directly bene him. The pilot pulls a lever--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire contents of the helicopters tanks dumps onto Godzilla, a torrent of fluid. Godzilla roars and dives. Charges EXPLODE. The other spraying helicopters keep up t onslaught, chasing the string of explosions. Godzilla resurfaces...right in the red-black amniotic flu slick. It coats him as he swims through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ARTILLERY SOLDIER listens to a radio.

dialogues.speaker: ARTILLERY SOLDIER
dialogues.text: We've got the fire order. We've got to keep it in the fluid as long as possible. 52.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Let's hope it doesn't just piss him off. The Artillery Soldier gives him a glance, turns to his jo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bright orange FLASHES as the artillery guns on the bridge fire-- EXPLOSIONS as the shells hit. Godzilla pulls back, into t center of the fluid. He slows. And CRIES OUT...a differen  59 sound than his roar. Sickly. In pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron frowns. He's still rooted to the spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Godzilla growls like a cornered animal. Then dives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lit by the glow of the monitors.

dialogues.speaker: PIKE
dialogues.text: What happened? Jill and Benedek exchange a glance...neither ventures a g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron searches the ocean. No sign of Godzilla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water is still...the Bridge eerily empty of movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly GODZILLA ERUPTS FROM THE WATER-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Godzilla clings to the center support of the bridge, visi through the window.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Damn. 53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron stares in shock. GODZILLA'S HEAD RISES OVER THE EDGE OF THE BRIDGE--almost staring at Aaron eye-to-eye. Aaron takes a step back. The artillery crew start running.  60

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: (into radio) Aaron--you idiot! Get out of there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Godzilla bites through several cables. They twang loudly they snap, and the bridge is wrenched. Aaron starts runni the footing no longer secure, trying to make it past sudd moving cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill runs out of the building. She can see Godzilla start climb the central pylon. The bridge is jarred. A car fall from it, into the bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bridge groans under Godzilla's weight. Godzilla shove himself through the cabling, onto the bridge. Artillery g fire. Godzilla cries out, sickly. Aaron runs, but the terrain is treacherous. The bridge sw dangerously under Godzilla's weight. Cars fall from it in bay. Godzilla uses a cable to pull himself to full height. He --and then collapses, falling forward, full onto the brid Cables groan--snap. Aaron grabs for a handhold--he swings thrown like a rag doll, hangs on. The Bridge contorts, sw But it holds. It is a bizarre, surrealistic image: Godzilla, one arm ha down, lying still on the Golden Gate Bridge. ON THE BRIDGE: Aaron continues to clutch his handhold. Hi radio crackles. 54.  61

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: (filtered) Aaron--Aaron, are you all right? Aaron fumbles for his radio, finds it.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: What a great bridge. Godzilla lies before him, vanquished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
