dialogues.text: Well-attended with townsfolk. The Waitress from the diner in the front pew. Colored light from a huge stained glass window backlights the REVEREND. Gray hair, very distingui very fire-and-brimstone--and really wailing:

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: ‘His breath kindleth coals, and a flame goeth out of his mouth. He maketh the deep to boil. When he raiseth himself up the mighty are afraid. The sword of him that layeth at him cannot hold'-- The two ranch hands--John and Stu, last seen in the rain frogs--sit in a pew in the back. They look out of place, both listen raptly as the Reverend continues. Unconscious Stu shakes a cigarette out of a pack, puts it in his mout

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (a hiss) You can't smoke in here! Stu looks abashed. They speak in whispers.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: Been awhile since I seen the insides of a church.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I figure better safe than sorry.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: That is the description of the Leviathan, as given to us in Job 41... Stu is stricken by a COUGHING ATTACK, a wet smoker's hack Reverend notices. John, embarrassed, edges away from Stu.  62 55.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: I see some new faces today. Welcome. In times of trouble, the House of the Lord is indeed a refuge. Stu, trying to stifle himself, rises from the pew. John s his head in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Those things are gonna kill you someday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu exits, still COUGHING. The church is a white-painted box, fairly secluded, tucked into a tree-covered hillside The pickup truck is parked outside. Stu notices the BORDE COLLIE, whimpering, tied by a leash to the truck. The lea taut as the Collie digs his legs, trying to get away.

dialogues.speaker: STU
dialogues.text: What's the matter, boy? (looks up at the clear sky) Afraid of getting warts? A mighty PULL, and the Collie's head slips out of its col It runs off. Stu curses, chases after it--

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: Now, why is the Lord telling Job this? The Lord is describing wonders that Job is incapable of understanding... A sudden loud THUMP, as if something heavy has hit the ro Eyes are raised as people scan the ceiling. The Reverend ignores it, preaching harder, trying to keep their attent

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: ...So Job will realize divine omnipotence and repent... Now there are ominous SCRABBLING SOUNDS, as if several he bugs are crawling across the roof. Nervous MURMURS in the congregation.  63

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND
dialogues.text: (looking up) The Lord goes on to describe a second creature, the Behemoth-- 56. Several parishioners SHUSH the Reverend, to his surprise. Waitress stands up, panic in her voice:

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: It's another plague--locusts, or hail. Just like the frogs-- (she points) Look at the window... The Reverend turns. Behind him, the stained-glass window been DARKENED by a shadow. The shadow MOVES, shrinking, resolving for just a moment into the shape of a FLYING BA --and then the stained-glass window SHATTERS as the giant bat CRASHES through, colored fragments flying. SCREAMS in the church, and PANDEMONIUM. Above, sections o roof are peeled away, and Probe-bats drop down-- John, in the back, is first to the doors. He pulls them o And is face-to-face with giant Probe-bat. It spreads its and SCREECHES. Other churchgoers, panicking, stampede out pushing John into the creature's claws--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu drags the Collie by the scruff of its neck; it fights every step of the way. Stu glances up--and gasps. He lets of the Collie; it bolts away. WHAT STU SEES: the church, crawling with the giant Probe- One of them lifts off from the torn roof, carrying a body Another sits on the Pickup truck, a dark sentry. It notic Stu, spreads its wings, lifts off-- Stu runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luck leads Stu into a stand of trees, cutting him off fro pursuing Probe-bat--  64 AERIAL VIEW - POV PROBE-BAT as STU races beneath the tree Stu stumbles, falls down an embankment. Rolls over and ov hits the bottom of the ravine. Spots a narrow overhang. C into it-- Eyes wide, Stu waits, frozen, holding his breath, terrifi A SCREECH comes, then a scrabbling sound. A Probe-bat has landed directly above the overhang. It hunts, scanning, listening... Suddenly Stu COUGHS. A smoker's wet hack. 57. Stu slaps a hand over his mouth, stifling the cough, but knows. He glances up-- The probe-bat stares down at him from the overhang, grinn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu's scream echoes through the woods, is suddenly cut of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Jeep, driven by Nelson Fleer, comes to a stop on the ro the church. It is laden with gear: tents, prospecting too dive tanks. Fleer steps out, sees-- The Waitress stumbling toward him. Beyond her, the church is partly torn off. Wood and bodies are strewn. Fleer hur to the Waitress; she collapses in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ambulance lights flash. Bodies are covered, carried away. Sheriff has a map spread out on the hood of his cruiser.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Fleer! Over here. Fleer squeezes the Waitress's hand, leaves her in the car ambulance medic. The Sheriff gestures to the map.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Right now we're assuming a tornado. I need you to round up  the other guides, conduct a search in this area. (grim) The bodies have to come down somewhere. Fleer nods back toward the Waitress.

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: Deborah's going on about some kind of giant bat--

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: (not surprised) Lots of debris swirlin' around a tornado. It's characteristic. Could've been stuff looked like flying goddamn elephants. Fleer nods, moves away. The Sheriff turns, sadly takes in scene: bodies, ambulances, ruined church. He sighs. 58.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: (to himself) What hath God wrought? And as if in answer, we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Probe-bats swoop down into the cave, carrying bodies- human, some animal. They move toward a TRANSLUCENT MASS a center--it is huge, crowding the cavern. The Probe-bats a tiny flies buzzing around it. Probe-bats land on the mass. The human and animal bodies DISSOLVE, ABSORBED into mass. Some of the Probe-bats merg well. Part of the mass SHIFTS--a giant claw, opening and closing. The larger picture falls into place, and we see the mass hunched, ominous ANIMAL SHAPE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill spots Benedek and Pike leaving the building. An argu in progress, Pike making his case. 65

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and this is on your authority?

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: It's on the President's authority.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: What do they recommend? Benedek can't meet her angry gaze.

dialogues.speaker: PIKE
dialogues.text: It's a one-of-a-kind life form. They want to keep it alive.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: No. Goddammit, no! We kill it! That's our mission--

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: We can kill it later. That is his last word. He strides away. Jill turns, stare Godzilla on the bridge, her jaw tight.

dialogues.speaker: PIKE
dialogues.text: Happens, I agree with you, Doctor. 59.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: (she turns away) Small comfort...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hand-held VIDEO following Benedek as reporters shove mics his face:

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: ...hearts go out to the families of the brave men and women lost in the battle with Godzilla...

dialogues.speaker: NETWORK REPORTER
dialogues.text: "Godzilla'--is that with one 'l' or two?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOT of a Newscaster; a video square over his shoulder sh Aaron in a crowd, people shoving copies of his book at hi 66

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --London gold shot up over two hundred dollars an ounce, attributed to the appearance of the San Francisco monster-- SHOT of Jill, striding past reporters, mics jammed in her She holds her anger in check--barely.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: --what do I think? I think they should transport it to the middle of the desert--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tina carries a tray into a dining area. People are cluste around a television mounted on the wall, watching Jill sp

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: --shove a nuclear bomb down its throat and blow it up. The Reporter turns away from her.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: ...that's Dr. Llewellyn, who has been credited with capturing the creature--which, we are told, first appeared in the Arctic sea-- Tina's eyes go wide. 60.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: --and may have been responsible for the loss of an expedition team there early last year... Tina sits slowly, the tray in her lap. ON SCREEN: Behind the Reporter, several Flying Crane heli buzz above the bridge--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --the helicopters drop to above Godzilla. A fire truck sp dark amniotic fluid onto Godzilla's skin. 67  68 BACK TO VIDEO as a silver tank, the size of a railroad ca lowered via helicopter onto the back of Godzilla's neck.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: ...I am told is a device that administers the fluid, keeping the creature sedated, if you will...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew guide the device into place. Huge hydraulic clam close, lock it onto Godzilla--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Jill; there is a ROAR from the crowd gathered at the s end of the bridge. Jill turns as the ROAR becomes a CHEER She watches as four Flying Crane helicopters strain at ca attached to Godzilla, LIFTING HIM INTO THE AIR above the The crowd cheers wildly-- BACK TO VIDEO - a LOCAL REPORTER, shirt untucked, does a stand-up. A wobbly ZOOM to the horizon, where a tiny Godz moves past, suspended by cables from the helicopters--a b Macy's New Year's Day Parade balloon.

dialogues.speaker: LOCAL REPORTER
dialogues.text: ...unconfirmed reports of gunfire near the Nevada border. Apparently some folk are taking pot shots at the creature-- SHOT of a LOCAL NEWSCASTER, a Godzilla-over-Utah graphic his left shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: LOCAL NEWSCASTER
dialogues.text: ...has been instructed to route the creature away from all inhabited areas. The FAA--
SHOT of a large crowd, partying, waving signs; a banner r BOULDER WELCOMES GODZILLA. A REPORTER finishes her stand- two boys near her waiting to be interviewed.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: --no word yet as to the creature's intended final destination. (turns to boys) Tell us, when you saw Godzilla, were you scared?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't scared.

dialogues.speaker: NINE-YEAR-OLD
dialogues.text: (considers it) Scared it was going to poop on us! The two crack up--

dialogues.speaker: FORT TUSCARORA BASE HOSPITAL
dialogues.text: Ed escorts Aaron, moving along briskly.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: How is he?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Not good. We've brought in specialists from John Hopkins. We're doing all we can, but... He stops at a doorway, pauses.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Be prepared. His appearance may be a shock. Don't dwell on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron and Ed enter. Marty's figure is obscured by monitor equipment. A SURGEON regards a FLUOROSCOPE SCREEN. The re time video shows a full-body x-ray of Marty. His heart be is a shadowy rhythmic blur.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: (peers at the screen) Christ...he's changed further? ON SCREEN: There is a large movement--a SHIFT--of an inte organ. Marty's liver? Whatever it is, it shouldn't be mov 62.

dialogues.speaker: SURGEON
dialogues.text: All of the large intestine is gone, along with the exocrine 69  tissue of the pancreas. The material was used here, in restructuring the chest cavity-- He indicates a spidery dark structure in Marty's chest.

dialogues.speaker: SURGEON
dialogues.text: Body functions necessary to immediate survival aren't affected. Everything else is fair game.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Impossible.

dialogues.speaker: SURGEON
dialogues.text: Apparently not. The infection is ve-scripting his DNA...and as it changes, he changes.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Changes...into what? The Surgeon shrugs. Aaron approaches the bed. He wears a very-convincing smile. He gets closer--and gasps. Marty has no eyes. His skull is elongated, his jaw shrunken. His ears have m onto the sides of his head. His clavicle and shoulders ha lifted, forming a protective collar around his neck. But most disconcerting is the flat, featureless expanse o from forehead to mouth.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Who's there? Marty's voice is groggy, weak. Aaron swallows.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Marty, we got him. Godzilla.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Is he dead?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: No. He's...sick, but alive.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Like me.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Actually, he looks a little better than you. 70  Marty smiles. Aaron looks away.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Aaron...I've had dreams. About Godzilla. Aaron forces himself to look back.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: I keep wondering...why now? (beat) Why show up now? What set the womb off? The interference... (beat) What is he trying to do? Marty lifts up, turns, his eyeless face searching for Aar

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: You have to find out. Aaron takes Marty's hand, grips it.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I need to stay here-- Marty shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: No. Please. I can...feel what's happening to me. Aaron looks at his friend, anguished.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I can't--

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: You have to find out. You need to keep looking. I've been having dreams... (beat) Remember Emperor Kuei Ko? Aaron frowns, remembering--then nods.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: (drifting off) 63. 71  72 Find out. Keep looking... Marty's features relax. His grip loosens, his breathing b regular. Ed appears behind Aaron, pulls him away. Near the door Aaron stops. Sighs heavily. Gazes at Marty' sleeping form. 64.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: (barely audible) Good-bye, Marty. Aaron looks at his friend one last time. Then turns away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill strides along the length of a huge structure. An Air ENGINEER falls in with her, tries to keep up.

dialogues.speaker: ENGINEER
dialogues.text: (apologetic) I'm real sorry about the tail.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Tail?

dialogues.speaker: ENGINEER
dialogues.text: See, the information I had said the creature was two hundred and fifty feet tall. They didn't tell me about a tail. So there was no way for me to know--

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Know what?

dialogues.speaker: ENGINEER
dialogues.text: Well, that it wouldn't fit-- They come to the corner of the structure. Jill pulls up s Incongruously sticking out through the massive doors on o is Godzilla's tail. Workers string 'POLICE LINE - DO NOT CROSS' tape around i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill enters, stares at--  73 Godzilla, laying on his side, mostly submerged in the tan An awesome sight. Close by is the too-long tail; in the distance, Godzilla's head lies above the water's surface. TECHNICIANS scurry about a control center which monitors Godzilla's vital signs.

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: (shouts) Power up the grid! Jill watches darkly as switches are pulled, huge generato RUMBLE to life-- 65. Several huge metal grids lower from the ceiling, down to above Godzilla. Electricity crackles across them. A loud echoes in the structure as it locks into place, trapping Godzilla in the tank. Jill turns away, angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill walks in. Beyond the glass wall, Godzilla slumbers. is much busyness in the room. The main monitor map has be changed: it now shows Godzilla's projected route as a lin across the United States. Jill scowls. She spots Aaron, talking to Ed, who sits at a keyboard. S strides toward them.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Here's a match. Modesto, California. 'A pair of twenty-six year old twins met for the first time Friday, despite having lived their whole lives within a hundred mile radius-- '

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: No. Keep looking

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: What's going on here? Who authorized this? Ed looks away sheepishly, a caught kid. Aaron is only a l less abashed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...I did.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: You did.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I'm sorry if I overstepped my boundaries, but Marty said something that got me thinking...Do you know the myth of Kuei Ko? Jill crosses her arms. Stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: You've co-opted my people and my department on the basis of one of your fractured fairy tales? 66.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Listen, okay? Kuei Ko was a mighty ruler with a vast kingdom...You know, the usual. One night, a sparrow came to him in a dream. It told him one of his wives was pregnant. (he's warming to it) Except it wasn't his child. His wife would give birth to a monster...a monster with the power to destroy him...his kingdom...and the world.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: (calling up from his keyboard) Wichita, Kansas. 'A hole-in-one is rare. Three consecutive aces on the same hole is almost impossible--'

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) Keep looking. So, anyway, Kuei Ko journeyed to the Land Without Light...to kill the monster before it could be born.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: 74  That's a lovely story. What does it have to do with this?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Did I mention that Kuei Ko was a dragon? What Marty meant, I think, was to find out where Godzilla was headed.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: What? Aaron points up at the map.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Godzilla was moving in a straight line--like he had a purpose. We just projected his route, and started looking along the line for reports of strange phenomenon and occurrences--

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: You think he had a purpose? That there's some...reason for-- 67.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Why now? Why did Godzilla show up now? He might not be an isolated incident--

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: You don't think we should kill him. Do you? (Aaron doesn't answer) Do you? They stare at each other. Ed lets out a low whistle, draw their attention.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Holy cow. Listen to this. Traveller, Utah. Three stories... "Additional cattle mutilations discovered,' uh, ‘church destroyed in freak accident...' Aaron leans forward.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: 76 "Strange lights reported in the sky over six counties...'

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: That's it. Utah. (beat) I think if Godzilla does have a purpose...that's where we'll find it. (a little frightened) This guess, I wouldn't mind being wrong. A beat, and then he exits. Jill turns to look through the at Godzilla.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: (to herself) Is it possible..? Then she starts: she has spotted a familiar figure in a w smock: Tina, looking very small, staring up into the face monster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the distinctive beating of Godzilla's heart. Tina stares, transfixed. Jill grabs her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Tina--how did you get in here? 68. Tina indicates the clearance badges pinned to her white s But Jill is taken aback by the tears glistening on Tina's and the resigned, serene set to her features. Tina nods t Godzilla.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: This...this is what killed Dad.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: (beat) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: This is what you're job was... finding it.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Yes. Killing it. Tina looks at Jill.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Why? What's the point? Jill is surprised by the question. It should be obvious.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Look at it! It's killed hundreds of people. It killed your father. Isn't that enough?

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: My God, mom...You look at it! Look at its scale. I bet it didn't even notice dad! (dryly) Except as maybe a little wet spot on the bottom of its foot.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Shut up! You don't know what you're talking about--

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Don't you say that. I know! You lost dad. (beat) I lost you both. Jill turns away. Anger, remorse, grief, war on her face. is close to tears. But an act of will puts a stop to it. 69.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: (tightly) You shouldn't be here. It's not safe. I spoke to Aunt Julia. She's out of town, but she said you could stay at her apartment. In New York. Tina gapes at her. She reaches a hand toward Jill--drops before contact is made.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Fine. I'm gone. She strides out, leaving Jill alone. Jill wipes at her ey  78 brushing away any tears that may have begun. Back in cont she looks up at Godzilla. In the water the monster shifts slightly, and a small, mo sound escapes from his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron steps out of his rental car, takes in the small tow heads for the Diner-- --and suddenly the Waitress appears in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: God is merciful, but the day of his wrath is come. Who shall be able to stand?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah...'Jesus wept.' He hurries past her into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron sits at the counter near Fleer, picks up a menu. Th Sheriff gives Aaron the once-over.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: If you're a reporter or a gawker, we don't need you here. A little apprehensive, Aaron hands over his I.D. badge. T Sheriff studies it.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I'm, uh, with the government. (beat) So what's there to gawk at? 70.

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: Huh. You can take your pick. We've got cattle mutilations, our church's been tore up-- Suddenly the Waitress is there, close to Aaron's ear.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: It's God's judgment. And the lights in the sky--that was his terrible swift sword. Aaron turns toward her, encouraging her.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: There were lights in the sky.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: (nods) Then came the frogs, that was our warning-- (Aaron frowns) A plague of frogs. Like Moses visited upon the Pharaohs-- She looks around, heads for a stack of newspapers. The Sh hands Aaron back his I.D., sighs.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: I'm sure getting tired of her saying ‘visited upon.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frogs

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Yeah...well, it rained...frogs.

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: Weird shit.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: See? They're the only ones willing to print it. She thrusts a tabloid newspaper at Aaron. We get a brief glimpse of the cover: COP TIPS WAITRESS 2M$. Inside, a ph John and Stu, holding buckets of frogs. Headline reads ‘T DESTROYED BY FROGS--Biblical Retribution?!

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: It's the end of the Millennium, and the Apocalypse is near. The wicked and just will do battle-- Aaron doesn't listen--he's thinking, figuring something o 71.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Is there a (beat Fairly iso visitors.. ten, fifte' Fleer and the Sheriff lake around here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: lated, not a lot of «but nearby, say within en miles... look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: Sounds like you're talking about Lake Apopka.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Lake Apopka. How do I get there?

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: You don't roads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: not in that car. No Aaron glances out the window. Spots Fleer's jeep, and Fle sign across the street.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: You're Nelson Fleer? (Fleer nods) Can I hire you? As a guide?

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: Hmm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Government man. You're those guys who pay five hundred bucks for a screwdriver, right? (grins, nods) We can work something out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fleer's Jeep takes o Sheriff shakes his h Governmen for this Fire and of God. She crosses herself. ff, Aaron hanging on for dear life. The ead, watching as it leaves.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: t man. Shit, what's next town?

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: brimstone and the wrath The Sheriff scowls at her, worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At an x-ray screen, the Surgeon confers with Benedek. 80  81 72.

dialogues.speaker: SURGEON
dialogues.text: The circulatory system is on the verge of collapse. (shakes his head) It simply may not be a viable life form--

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: What can you do? They move back toward the bed, where an anesthesiologist nurse prepare instruments.

dialogues.speaker: SURGEON
dialogues.text: The immediate threat is liquid creating pressure on the brain stem. We have to drain it. Benedek considers.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: Do it. A hand--more like a claw now--grabs Benedek's wrist.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY /ALIEN
dialogues.text: |Wait. | Benedek stares down at-- Marty--who is now more ALIEN than human. He has eyes again--huge ebony orbs that seem to have erup from beneath his skin. His head is disfigured--he is grow exoskeleton. His nose is just two slits.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY /ALIEN
dialogues.text: |There is a |reason|. Bring | |...Llewellyn. | Marty's voice isn't his voice anymore--it HISSES from dee his throat. Rhythm, inflection, tone are all different. Frightened, the Surgeon backs away; he knocks over the instrument tray. Instruments CLATTER to the floor--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill hurries in, moves to Benedek's side. Looks at Marty.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: 82 Has he said anything else?

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: A few words. This is going to sound crazy, but...I don't know if it's him speaking...or it. 73.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: It?

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: The thing he's turning into--

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: I need to talk to him. (corrects herself) It. Whatever. Jill moves to the bed. Touches Marty's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Marty? Can you hear me? Marty's huge new eyes focus on her. His face contorts. An incredible effort, an incredible strain, for one word:

dialogues.speaker: MARTY /ALIEN
dialogues.text: |Danger...|

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: What kind of danger? Again, Marty's body contorts-- Then, it's as if something just gives up. Marty's face re His expression is calm, serene. Suddenly:

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: (distorted, but normal inflection) Dr. Llewellyn...is that you?

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Yes. Uh...you can call me Jill.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: It...doesn't know the words yet. So...I have to talk...

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Marty...does it...are you in pain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -..no. It's amazing, Jill. I see in infra-red now--I think. The Surgeon checks the cardiograph monitor. Frowns.

dialogues.speaker: SURGEON
dialogues.text: He's in a brachycardia state. (to Jill) He's weakening. Jill takes Marty's hand/claw.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: You--it--said the word 'danger.' Mary pauses, as if listening. Then:

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Aliens...spreading through the stars...Destroying worlds... Stunned silence in the room.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: There was a time...that would have sounded crazy.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: How, Marty?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Alien probe lands...on a world...creates a...beast out of the genetic material of that world. Designed to kill--

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: (surprised) Godzilla is an alien--? Marty's face and body contract. His voice is a low hiss:

dialogues.speaker: MARTY/ALIEN
dialogues.text: |No. Not Godzilla. Another. |

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: (the worst possible news) 83  Another?

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: An alien creature? Marty's features relax. Jill leans EXTREME CLOSE UP, Marty's face, black eyes staring blankl

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: A doomsday beast...is created. It...reproduces. Destroys. Wipes out dominate life forms... (beat) Later, the aliens come. To a planet already...conquered... forward.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: One is coming here--that's the danger? When will it arrive? 75.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: It's already here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fleer's truck bounces up a steep rise, Aaron hanging on.

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: So what are you thinking happened?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I think the lights in the sky were caused by a meteor...It drops through the atmosphere. Friction superheats it to about a thousand degrees centigrade. (illustrates with hand gestures) It hits the water, and the water boils instantly. The steam evacuates up...cold air rushes in, forms a water spout, which sucks up everything around it--

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: --and ten miles away, it rains 84  85 frogs and fish-- They reach the top of the rise, pull to a stop. Look out- WIDE SHOT - LAKE APOPKA. Or what is left of it. The epice of a huge explosive force. Trees snapped like twigs, bent backward out from the lake. Mud and dying moss surround i water level half what it should be. Fleer stares, surveying the damage with awe. Aaron gazes speculatively at the lake.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Can we go in there?

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: How's that?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: What I'm looking for might--must be in there. Fleer smiles. Hops out of the Jeep. Grabs one of the tank

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: Underwater. Imagine that. There's a rate jump from wilderness guide to dive expedition leader. (grins) Big jump. 76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill knows time may be short. She hurries her questions:

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Marty--this...creature you are becoming. Where did it come from?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Civilization...old...from the stars...gone now. Earth had three moons, then. (as if seeing it) Huh. Pretty.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: What was it called? Atlantis? Lemuria? Mu?  Suddenly the thing speaks through Marty:

dialogues.speaker: MARTY /ALIEN
dialogues.text: |We needed words...needed to warn you... did not know what form life would take... Jill gets a look of understanding--even amazement.

dialogues.speaker: SURGEON
dialogues.text: ...so they created a virus that would reprogram DNA...and transfer RNA? Amazing.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: They made one of theirs out of one of ours-- Marty's body spasms. On the cardiograph Marty's heart is flutter. The Surgeon turns to Jill.

dialogues.speaker: SURGEON
dialogues.text: Dr. Llewellyn--we're losing him-- Jill leans close to Marty.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Marty--can you tell us--what is Godzilla?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY /ALIEN
dialogues.text: |We left it in stasis...created from dinosaur genetic template. Alien probe would awaken it...|

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: How do we kill it? 77.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY /ALIEN
dialogues.text: |Godzilla will kill it. Before it ...reproduces--|

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: No--not the beast. How do we kill Godzilla?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY /ALIEN
dialogues.text: (voice fading) |Can't...kill...Godzilla... Marty loses consciousness. The EKG stops BEEPing. Flatli

dialogues.speaker: SURGEON
dialogues.text: Crash cart! Code blue! Nurses, the Surgeon move in, try to resuscitate Marty. Th monitor stays flatline. Jill rises. Stands back, away from the flurry of activity around Marty...stunned by his final words. MARTY (Cont'd) Earth had three moons, then. (as if seeing it) Huh. Pretty.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: What was it called? Atlantis? Lemuria? Mu? Suddenly the thing speaks through Marty:

dialogues.speaker: MARTY /ALIEN
dialogues.text: |We needed words...needed to warn you... did not know what form life would take... | Jill gets a look of understanding--even amazement.

dialogues.speaker: SURGEON
dialogues.text: .so they created a virus that would reprogram DNA...and transfer RNA? Amazing.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: They made one of theirs out of one of ours-- Marty's body spasms. On the cardiograph Marty's heart is flutter. The Surgeon turns to Jill.

dialogues.speaker: SURGEON
dialogues.text: Dr. Llewellyn--we're losing him-- Jill leans close to Marty. 78.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Marty--can you tell us--what is Godzilla? 87  Marty loses

dialogues.speaker: MARTY /ALIEN
dialogues.text: |We left it in stasis...created from dinosaur genetic template. Alien probe would awaken it.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: How do we kill it?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY /ALIEN
dialogues.text: |Godzilla will kill it. Before it ...reproduces--|

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: No--not the beast. How do we kill Godzilla?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY /ALIEN
dialogues.text: (voice fading) |Can't...kill...Godzilla...| consciousness. The EKG stops BEEPing. Flatlines

dialogues.speaker: SURGEON
dialogues.text: Crash cart! Code blue! Nurses, the Surgeon move in, try to resuscitate Marty. Th monitor stays flatline. Jill rises. Stands back, away from the flurry of activity around Marty...stunned by his final words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fleer and Aaron, in the water, adjust their diving equipm Fleer watches Aaron, measuring him. Aaron nods.

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: So. Done much diving?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Some. At Club Med once--

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: Well, this is nothing like that. In cave diving, you're going into absolute pitch dark. There're weird currents and sharp rocks-- Fleer clips safety line, flashlight, slate and pencil onto his belt. 88

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: Just try not to panic. You don't want to be like the kid who sucked his mouthpiece into his throat trying to get the last cubic centimeter of air-- They back their way into the water.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: If cave-diving is so dangerous, why do you do it? Fleer sets his dive watch, fits his mask.

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: Better than the ocean. There you got eels, squid, jellyfish... (he shudders) Too much weird shit. He sinks down backwards into the water. Aaron follows--

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Fleer and Aaron swim through flickering shafts of sunligh Discharged air bubbles glitter, swirl toward the surface. The CAVE OPENING looms ahead. They follow their flashligh beams into darkness. Fleer, in the lead, spots something- Ahead the cave narrows to a tight bottleneck. Fleer pulls packet of red dye, breaks it. The bright-colored dye move steadily away from the opening, indicating a current. Fleer gives Aaron a ‘thumbs up' sign. He ties his safety to a rock outcropping...then removes his tank. Aaron look him incredulously. Still breathing through the regulator, Fleer shoves his t through the bottleneck. He then squirms through after it- Aaron can't believe it. Slowly he removes his own tank. P it through ahead of him, following Fleer.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: P.O.V., AARON, through his dive mask, the narrow angle increasing the sense of claustrophobia. We hear his BREAT slow and steady, as he moves past limestone walls. The walls give way; Aaron and Fleer emerge into open wate 89  90 Fleer glances up. Sees the surface above. Grins, motions Aaron. Swims upward-- 80. --suddenly, shockingly, coming straight at him, BRIGHT in light of his flashlight is the MOUNTAIN LION. Fleer freaks out. Flails his arms, legs, trying to get aw The Mountain Lion APPROACHES, fangs bared in a perpetual snarl...then floats serenely past, suspended in the water by the current. It spins, caught in an eddy. We see it's pretty well torn A paw and some of its torso are still connected to the he most of the body is gone. Fleer recovers. Calms himself. Aaron taps him on the shou Fleer holds up his hand--he's okay. He scribbles on his s holds it up to Aaron. It says 'RATE DOUBLED."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron breaks the surface of the underground lake. Fleer i already climbing out of the water. He yanks off his mask.

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: God damn what was that doing there? I don't need that shit in my life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He squirms out of his tank. Aaron climbs out of the water

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: (still pissed off) And what's that smell? Aaron examines the limestone cavern. Most is obscured by darkness. In one corner, a waterfall splashes down. Aaron spots something, moves toward it--

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Over here. It is the mutilated remains of a cow. Aaron crouches next it. Fleer stares--now he's seen it all.

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: A cow.  91

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Odd--there's not just physical damage. Looks like chemical deterioration as well. A sudden, disorienting shift to-- P.O.V., LOOKING DOWN at Aaron and Fleer, from out of a cr Watching them-- 81.

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: Something must've dragged it in here. The mountain lion? The thing above them SHIFTS...then leaps forward, swoopin toward them--

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Maybe whatever got the mountain lion-- Fleer jumps. SWOOPING past are several small, dark shapes bats. Just normal-sized bats, providing a false scare. Fl waves at them, cursing, shooing them away. Aaron ignores the bats, glances around the chamber. Spots something. Frowns.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: My God...

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: What? He looks toward where Aaron is looking. Thirty feet away what seems to be a unique rock formation--a GIANT CLAW, a as a house. Aaron climbs a boulder to get a better view, reaches the Fleer follows. Beyond them we see the claw is part of a h forearm, which is part of a massive HUNCHED ANIMAL SHAPE, filling the cavern--

dialogues.speaker: THE GRYPHON
dialogues.text: Huge. Magnificent. Horrible. A nightmare waiting to be born. Leathery, blood-red wings like a bat. The body of a mount lion. It resembles the mythical Gryphon, as in Junji's  92 drawings. This is what the huge bat-probe creatures created by merg none are left to be seen. Aaron and Fleer are ants before

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: (awed) ...the Behemoth... Aaron takes an emergency flare from Fleer's belt, lights BRIGHT LIGHT fills the cavern, chasing the shadows-- Smoke drifts up from the flare. High above, the Gryphon's twitches. It scowls, eyes still closed-- 82. Aaron holds the flare high. They turn slightly as they lo taking the creature in. Behind them, they do not see as t giant claw CLUTCHES.

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: It's not alive--nothing that big could be alive... (beat) It goes all the way to the ceiling--

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: That's not a ceiling. Those are wings. The turn back toward the huge claw--as it CLUTCHES again-

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: Shit! It's alive-- Fleer grabs the flare from Aaron, drops it, STOMPS on it. still burns. Cursing, he STOMPS some more, extinguishing Too late. The giant monster shifts...MOVES. Walls of the cavern split; huge chunks of rocks fall--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron and Fleer scramble back toward the lake, grab up th gear. The Gryphon lets out a bone-jarring SCREAM-- Fleer looks over his shoulder, sees inside its mouth--

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: Oh, God. It's got snakes. Snakes for a tongue-- And it does. Many snakes, a hydra-headed thing, squirming  93 the tongue should be. It's eyes glow yellow in the darkne reflecting light like a cat's eyes. Fleer and Aaron leap into the pool--

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Aaron and Fleer plunge in. A SNAKE HEAD darts into the wa snapping blindly. Aaron twists away, avoids getting bitte half. The Snake-head withdraws-- Fleer finds the safety line. They pull themselves along. hear the SOUND of BREATHING, loud and fast, through their regulators-- They reach the bottleneck. Muffled ROARS of the Gryphon c heard. Fleer and Aaron snake out of their tanks-- In the cave, one of the Gryphon's claws SLAMS down into t underground lake. 83. Water SURGES; Fleer slams into the rock wall, loses hold regulator. He swims into the bottleneck-- Aaron takes a last breath from his regulator. Lets go of equipment. Follows Fleer, through the narrow opening--

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Fleer shoots through the circular opening, followed by Aa They swim for the daylight--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fleer and Aaron break the surface, gasping for air. Suddenly, the earth TREMBLES--then SHAKES. Beyond a rise, concessive force blasts dirt and boulders into the sky. Aaron and Fleer swim, stagger up onto shore. Beyond them, Gryphon stands, rises to its full height above the trees. The nightmare has been born.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It shakes off rocks and debris. Its skin is smooth and sl It blinks in the sun. Screams its ear-splitting SCREAM--  94

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --the SCREAM echoes, fades. Soldiers and technicians go a their tasks. A few yards from Godzilla's jaws, A FOREMAN SURVEYOR use ultrasound equipment to scan Godzilla. On a small table, a Styrofoam cup blows over, spills. The Surveyor notices, looks at the Foreman accusingly.

dialogues.speaker: SURVEYOR
dialogues.text: Hey. Thanks for spilling my coffee.

dialogues.speaker: FOREMAN
dialogues.text: Huh? Not me. They do not notice as flat lines on their monitor are interrupted with tiny spikes--

dialogues.speaker: SURVEYOR
dialogues.text: (points at the cup) Yeah you did. Look. They look at cup--just as it leaps completely off the tab They look at each other, puzzled. A beat, then the entire table overturns in a blast of win The two look toward Godzilla's jaws-—

dialogues.speaker: SURVEYOR
dialogues.text: Ohshit--it's awake-- 84.

dialogues.speaker: FOREMAN
dialogues.text: (backing away) Okay. Um...let's give it some room-- A low GROWL from deep in Godzilla's throat. Technicians immediately drop their equipment, run-- Godzilla twists, turns...water SLOSHES over from the tank knocking a fleeing soldier off his feet. Godzilla rises up-- HUGE SPARKS, BOLTS OF ELECTRICITY SHOOT ACROSS him as he contact with the metal grid above. Godzilla falls back, trapped. There is an anguished, angry ROAR--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 95 Fleer and Aaron crouch behind a tree. They break cover, f uphill toward Fleer's Jeep. Looming over the lake, the Gryphon opens its wings and SC snake-tongue writhing. Energy builds up along its wings, OUT, a deadly ENERGY BOLT-- --a tree near the Jeep EXPLODES as Aaron and Fleer dive i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jeep bounces along, Aaron driving. Fleer looks back-- THE GRYPHON RISES UP INTO THE SKY, its giant leathern win spread wide, blotting out the sun--

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: Shit. It can fly--

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Hang on. Aaron swerves the Jeep hard onto a two-lane road, nearly it. In the distance is a railroad overpass. GRYPHON'S P.O.V., above the Jeep, gaining on it. The Jeep disappears under the overpass. Appears on the other side. ENERGY BOLTS shoot out-- --and the Jeep EXPLODES spectacularly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the dark shade of the overpass. Aaron gets to his feet dusts himself off. Fleer sits there, staring at his ruine burning Jeep, and the Gryphon, swooping off into the sky. 85.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Let me guess--you just finished paying it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A balding TOURIST, his family in a station wagon, does th funny little dance you do trying to get the gas hose unta He succeeds only in making it more twisted.  96 In his struggles he does not notice the surrealistic sigh behind him: in the distance, coming over a rise in the ro THE GRYPHON, down on all fours, stalking toward town, sli along like a cat. In the station wagon, a TOURIST KID notices the creature. eyes widen. He hurriedly searches for something inside a bag...rummages desperately, finally pulls out-- --a video camera. He switches it on, aims it at the Gryph Just as the Gryphon POUNCES onto a roadside bait shop, SM it. The Tourist turns, sees the creature. Drops the gas h dives into the station wagon. The Gryphon SCREAMS--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Waitress, in front of the cafe, freezes at the sound scream. The Sheriff exits the cafe, stops, staring past h look of horror on his face. She turns slowly to see-- The Gryphon, rising to full height over the town, the Tou station wagon fleeing before it. A panel truck going the way slams on its breaks. The Gryphon paws at it--the truc hit with such force it stands up, spins on one corner of chassis. The Sheriff rushes past the Waitress.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: In the truck--hurry! But the Waitress doesn't move. At the other end of town, the Gryphon glances around, spo something-- The above-ground gas storage tank near the gas station. N it is a large propane tank. The Gryphon crouches. ENERGY BEAMS SHOOT OUT, and the tan

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: (to Waitress) Come on! 86. But the Waitress chooses to run, down the center of the s The Sheriff dives into the cab--  97 The Gryphon beats its wings, FANNING the fire. A WAVE OF FLAMING GASOLINE rolls across Traveller-- The Waitress is engulfed in flames. She continues to run steps, burning, then falls to the ground. Satisfied, the Gryphon takes to the air, leaving the ruin the town behind--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruined. Destroyed. Aaron and Fleer hurry up the road...sl they survey the devastation. Fleer is near tears. Aaron approaches the dazed Sheriff, sitting on the burned of the cafe.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Is it still alive? Where did it go?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: It's gone...it took off. (points) That way.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: East? Shit. I need your truck. The Sheriff nods. Aaron moves toward the truck. To Fleer:

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: C'mon. There's a jet waiting. I've got to get back to the Project. (to Fleer) You coming? Fleer is incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: You're going up in the air? With that thing?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: You want to take your chances on the ground? Fleer glances around at the ruined town--  98 87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pandemonium. Jill, Benedek present. Godzilla's ROARS can heard. Ed rushes in from the holding tank.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: (to Jill) The fluid isn't working. It's just the grid holding him-- To one side, a TECHIE monitors channels. A SPECIAL BULLET flashes on. The Comm Officer stares. Turns to Jill:

dialogues.speaker: TECHIE
dialogues.text: Doctor, I've got a broadcast here, local news-- ON SCREEN: the shaky, hand-held image of the Gryphon, sho the Tourist Kid through back window of the station wagon.

dialogues.speaker: TECHIE
dialogues.text: Doctor, it seems to be another creature.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: What? All eyes turn to the screen. CAMERA bounces wildly, settl the Gryphon as it fires; the gas tank EXPLODES. Horribly, are to re-witness the scenes of Traveller's destruction. The Gryphon fans the flames, and we see the Waitress burn to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: Jesus--

dialogues.speaker: TECHIE
dialogues.text: Aaron Vaught is reporting in-- Jill gestures to hear it on the main speaker. The jet's turbines can be heard; they are in-flight.

dialogues.speaker: AARON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) --creature has wings like a bat. The body of a lion, like the mythical Gryphon...It can fire what seem to be electric bolts--

dialogues.speaker: FLEER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Like a goddamn eel...  99

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Aaron, Jill here. Where is it headed? 88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron sits in the co-pilot's seat. Through his window, in distance, is the Gryphon. Aaron watches it as the jet overtakes, passes it.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: It's headed east. Jill, I think it's coming toward you. I think--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone knows what this means.

dialogues.speaker: AARON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) --it's coming to kill Godzilla. As if in answer, Godzilla ROARS, vibrating the entire str

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Godzilla's huge tail whips back and forth, dangerously ne base power station. With the next whip, Godzilla's tail hits the station. The a SHOWER of SPARKS-- --and then the power station EXPLODES--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALARMS sound loudly. The lights go out--only the monitors lit. Emergency lights come on.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Uh-oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Godzilla ROARS--  100

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a THUNDERING, RIPPING SOUND, Godzilla RISES, crashin straight up through the roof of the structure. Part of th dangles on Godzilla like a hat--it looks kind of dumb. Al angrily, Godzilla knocks it away-- 89. A SOLDIER flees Godzilla. He zigs, zags-- --as the shadow of the roof segment gets larger-- --then lands right on top of him. A beat, then we see the soldier, unhurt, climbing out though an upper window of t roof. He darts away just as it gets stepped on-- Jill steps out of the building. People flee past her as s stands, staring at Godzilla. Tanks on the periphery of the airfield FIRE at Godzilla, little effect. Godzilla turns, scanning the horizon. He s seems to look directly at Jill. Is he aware of her, or st in her direction simply by chance? We don't know. Jill stares back at the monster. The moment is broken by the distant SOUND of a boat horn. Godzilla abruptly turns in the direction of the sound--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Godzilla approaches, drops down onto all fours. He slips the water. He sinks, and is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small passenger plane flies above the river. Marshland either side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VACATIONER snaps photos out the window.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: As the central river artery of the United States, the Mississippi is one of the busiest commercial waterways in the world--  101

dialogues.speaker: VACATIONER
dialogues.text: Hey. Cool statue. The Pilot pauses. Frowns.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: There's no statue on this tour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane is buzzing over-- The GRYPHON. It takes to the air, flying up past the pass plane. The plane is shaken by the turbulence caused by it massive wings. 90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane is out of control. The Vacationer looks sick.

dialogues.speaker: VACATIONER
dialogues.text: Next time, I just stay home. No more traveling, no more-- The Pilot fights the controls as the plane dives.

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: (calling out) Godzilla's been sighted. Moving slowly down Long Island Sound, south of Bridgeport. The room is crowded, bustling. Jill and Benedek look up.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Given their relative speed--where will they meet?

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: We're calculating it now. On the main monitor is a map. Two electronic lines are dr it, one projecting Godzilla's path and extending it... The other projects the Gryphon's path, extends it... Aaron bursts into the situation room. Fleer follows.  102

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: What happened out there?

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: (simply) He left.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: We just got in the way. Godzilla's...instinctually programmed--to find that thing-- ON THE MONITOR: The lines are drawing closer

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: And kill it. Before it can multiply. Marty told us before he... (beat) Aaron...he died. Aaron knew it was coming, but it's still a shock. Jill reaches out to him--hesitates, then takes his hand. looks up at her, nods, smiles sadly. 91. ON THE MONITOR: The two lines intersect at...

dialogues.speaker: ED
dialogues.text: Oh, shit. (a little awed) Manhattan. Jill freezes, goes pale. It hits her that Tina is in dang

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: Do we even try to evacuate? It might kill more people than it saves--

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: You got to tell 'em. Give them a chance--

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: (nodding) We can't just abandon people--

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: What do you think, Dr. Llewellyn?  103 Jill hasn't been listening, lost in her own thoughts. She to a phone. Quickly punches a number.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: Dr. Llewellyn? We hear the BUSY SIGNAL. The call did not go through. Jill drops the phone. Heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Tina is in New York.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: You can't leave now--

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Tina is more important. (beat; her advice:) We can't just abandon people. And with that she is out the door. Benedek, Aaron and Fle watch her go. A beat; then Benedek turns to Aaron.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: As acting head of the St. George Project, what is your advice to the military? 92.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Uh...evacuate New York City. Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tina, scared, bangs futility on the buttons of the phone. "All circuits busy' message plays in her ear. The televis on, tuned to CNN, showing the Utah footage of the Gryphon

dialogues.speaker: CNN ANCHOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Once again, we'll show you dramatic footage of the Utah monster that now appears to be approaching New York City... Again, we see flames, the burning waitress stumble and fa  104 Tina gives up on the phone, rushes for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tina exits the foyer door, stops at the first step, shock The street in front of her is PANDEMONIUM. Cars jam the s horns HONKING. LOOTERS stream in and out of a corner groc store. A trash can, contents in flames, is thrown onto th of a police car. On the bottom steps of the stairs a DEVOUT WOMAN kneels, beside her, praying intently. A teenager snatches the pur rummages through it. Nothing. He throws it at the woman. She doesn't seem to care. She looks at Tina, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DEVOUT WOMAN
dialogues.text: (holds out her hands) Pray with me, darling. Pray for the rapture to take us. Tina backs away, into the foyer. Slams the door shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Huey helicopter, carrying Jill, flies over the East Riv past the Brooklyn Bridge, crowded with evacuating people. HUEY PILOT listens to his headphones.

dialogues.speaker: HUEY PILOT
dialogues.text: Manhattan airspace just became restricted to essential only.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: I've got clearance. 93.

dialogues.speaker: HUEY PILOT
dialogues.text: I know...I'm just saying-- He chokes on his words. Jill follows his stare: The Gryphon moves lazily through the sky.

dialogues.speaker: HUEY PILOT
dialogues.text: ..-it's real... He veers the Huey away from Manhattan.  105

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: HUEY PILOT
dialogues.text: I just stopped being essential.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Wrong. You're taking me into Manhattan. Turn this thing around. The Huey Pilot gives her a hard stare--then banks the cop hard, makes a beeline straight for the Wall Street Helipo keeps the Huey hovering just above the ground.

dialogues.speaker: HUEY PILOT
dialogues.text: Here we are. Manhattan.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: My daughter's in the village--

dialogues.speaker: HUEY PILOT
dialogues.text: Then she's on her own. The Huey Pilot starts to lift the copter. Jill pushes ope door, jumps out.

dialogues.speaker: HUEY PILOT
dialogues.text: Have a nice walk. And he's gone, heading the Huey back across the river. A black Apache Gunship cuts across the Huey's path, heading Governor's Island. WE DROP DOWN from the helicopters to the East River. The skyline reflected in the water. Just south of the Brookly Bridge, something disturbs the stillness: Half above the surface are GODZILLA'S EYES as he pushes t the river.

dialogues.speaker: GOVERNOR'S ISLAND
dialogues.text: Aaron, Fleer and Benedek are at the hastily constructed C Post, near the water's edge. Phones, communication gear, monitors. Across the water is the Manhattan skyline, and Liberty Island. The Statue of Liberty prominent--  106

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: That thing is really pissing me off-- --and we see it's not the Statue. The Gryphon has clawed onto the pedestal. The Lady has fallen before it; she lie crushed and broken at its feet. The black Apache GUNSHIP, bristling with weaponry, lands. steps out, unintimidated by the whirring rotors. He nods crew--wearing all black, no military insignia. Pike heads the command post.

dialogues.speaker: PIKE
dialogues.text: Godzilla's in the East River, headed this way. (to Aaron) I don't want to hear any quotes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Godzilla reaches the docks of the lower East Side and pul himself ashore, blithely doing major property damage. ON THE BROOKLYN BRIDGE: Godzilla is spotted. Cars, gridlo by the evacuation, are abandoned as the people flee. ON THE DOCKS: Godzilla ignores the people who run from hi pauses, gets his bearings. Rips through the EL tracks. A jumps the line. He moves through the canyon of buildings the Battery, at the tip of the island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOOTERS emerge from shattered windows, toss guns into the of a van. One has an armful of automatic weapons.

dialogues.speaker: LOOTER
dialogues.text: Look! Full auto! Guy had 'em locked in the back! His cohort is about to reply--but his jaw drops. He stare something behind the Looter--then turns and runs. 95. The Looter turns. Godzilla towers above. Steps toward him

dialogues.speaker: LOOTER
dialogues.text: 107 Holy...Get away! Get away! He drops all but one rifle, starts FIRING up at Godzilla. Godzilla's eyes narrow. He takes another step-- The Looter is crushed beneath Godzilla's foot. Godzilla s a few more times for good measure. Turns-- Beyond Battery Park, across the water, is Liberty Island. the Gryphon. Godzilla ROARS-- The Gryphon's head whips around. It sees Godzilla. Godzilla stretches himself to full height, an obvious cha ROARS again. The Gryphon SCREAMS. Spreads its wings. Takes to the air. It rushes towards Godzilla-- Godzilla waits--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gathered watch as Godzilla is lifted bodily, rammed b

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: That's gotta hurt--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Godzilla grabs the Gryphon's leg, pulls it down-- The Gryphon flaps furiously, pulling away-- Godzilla wraps his tail, monkey-like, around the I-Beams under-construction building. The Gryphon SCREAMS-- Godzilla hauls it nearer-- --and BITES into the leg-- The Gryphon CRIES OUT in pain, rears back-- --and fires a BOLT at Godzilla-- Godzilla is blown backwards, into the building skeleton, topples-- The Gryphon presses its advantage, FIRES another bolt-- Godzilla staggers, moves off, back into the concrete cany  108 96. The Gryphon soars past him, turns, then comes straight ba rakes him with extended talons-- Godzilla ROARS. The Gryphon SCREAMS--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SCREAM echoes. Jill glances up. The streets are nearl deserted. Scattered fires burn. Something SHATTERS behind she turns, sees nothing--quickens her pace, up the steps the apartment building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill moves along warily. Doors are broken in; property scattered through the hallway. The aftermath of smash-and looting. An apartment door bursts open-- Two young boys run past Jill, carrying stereo equipment. Jill catches her breath, hurries to a door. It's closed t She tries the knob. Locked. Bangs on the door.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Tina! Tina-- The door snaps open--and Jill's staring down the barrel o automatic.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: I told you: go away-- (she recognizes Jill)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom! She grabs Jill in an embrace. They speak at once.

dialogues.speaker: JILL TINA
dialogues.text: Tina, you're all right, I can't believe you're Thank God... here-- Jill holds her back at arms length, examining her, reliev Her eyes fall on the gun. She frowns.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Aunt Julia's. It's safe. (puts on the safety) Safety's on. She sticks it in her waistband. Jill considers saying som then shrugs.  109

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: I'm...glad you came. They gaze at each other, sixteen years of history between and then they embrace again, holding on to each other. 97.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Now, we've just got to find a way off this damn island...

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: (laughs) ...just like Gilligan... Jill smiles--and the deep THWUP-THWUP of a HELICOPTER reverberates through the building. Jill looks up--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A helicopter swoops and banks, trying to keep up with the Gryphon. The Gryphon soars over the buildings, chasing Godzilla, who scurries along the streets, sometimes on al fours, a mouse chased by a hawk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gryphon spots Godzilla, between the Twin Towers. Scow realizes: it is Godzilla's reflection in the north tower. Gryphon banks around, swoops down, toward the image-- --then turns, lashes out at the Godzilla near the south t smashing it-- Except that's a reflection, too. During the Gryphon's ban turn, Godzilla moved to the other side. Godzilla springs Gryphon, teeth and claws tearing into its wings. The Gryphon throws itself backwards, smashing Godzilla ag the Tower. They flail violently, crushing and destroy the Tower's base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, dust rises from the World Trade Center. the towers leans over dangerously. The monitors show heli views of the battle. Benedek, Fleer and Pike are ashen.  110

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: Can even Godzilla beat that thing?

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: Don't be defeatist...

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: (to himself) Why isn't he using his fire? He stares at the monitors, trying to figure it out. 98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gryphon pulls itself into the air. Godzilla makes a l snap for its legs--catches them, hauls the Gryphon down. The Gryphon reverses its momentum suddenly, sending both monsters hard into the dangerously leaning tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON JILL AND TINA. They look up as-- The TOWER COLLAPSES-- The ground shakes beneath their feet. Loose masonry crash down around them--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The observers are aghast--a dust cloud rises from the cit skyline now absent one-half of the World Trade Center. And then the Gryphon appears, flying shakily, still aloft It fires another bolt--

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: It...survived that...

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: The restraining device!

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: We've got to get it off him! It's keeping Godzilla from using his  111 fire! Hell, it's probably-- He cuts off. An image on a monitor catches his eye. ON SCREEN: Godzilla, slumped against a building. Not movi

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: My God...

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: It's probably killing him.

dialogues.speaker: PIKE
dialogues.text: That's a good thing, Vaught. We want these things dead, remember? And if one kills off the other that's one less we have to kill.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: You don't get it, do you? We've got nothing to fear from Godzilla-- 99.

dialogues.speaker: PIKE
dialogues.text: You're insane! Look at what its caused-- Aaron turns away dismissively. Deals only with Benedek

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Admiral, we've got to get that thing off him. Benedek looks down at Godzilla's image on the monitor. Re a decision. Looks at Aaron.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: How? Pike starts to object--but Benedek cuts him off.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: My command, Mr. Pike. (to Aaron) How?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Um... From behind him, Fleer speaks up.

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: c-4, Plastique explosive.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: (to Benedek, without missing a beat) C-4. Plastique explosive. (to Fleer) How do we plant them?

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: We..? He and Aaron lock eyes, regard each other.

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: You're serious about this? Aaron does not need to answer. Fleer sighs.

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: No amount of money is worth this... (beat) We need a helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill and Tina at a pay phone. Jill drops the receiver. 100.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: All circuits busy...Dammit. She spots an electronics store across the street. Strides toward it. Picks up a fallen chunk of masonry--

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Mom--what are you doing? --Jill hurls the chunk at the window, SHATTERS it.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: (shocked admiration) Mom... Jill reaches in, grabs a cellular phone. A sign beside it "TRY OUR DEMO--make a free call.' She starts punching but

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: I think the owner'll be eligible 112  federal disaster assistance... (into phone) Llewellyn, Jill. Security code: seven alpha. Day code: plant, echo, water. Voice print: 'Mary had a little lamb, its fleece--' (beat) Yes--get me Admiral Benedek--I don't care where he is, connect me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A phone chirps. Benedek picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: Benedek. (beat) Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Manhattan. My daughter and I. We need a lift out of here.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: I can't do it. The only thing we're sending in now are gunships to provide cover for Vaught.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: What? Why? What's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: He's going to get the restraining device off Godzilla. He says its keeping Godzilla from beating the Gryphon. What do you think? Jill considers...and comes to a conclusion.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: (simply) You should believe him. He knows what he's talking about.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDEK
dialogues.text: You should get to cover--find a 101. 113  114 basement fallout shelter-- Jill has closed the phone, cutting him off.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: (thinking aloud) Aaron will make them land... (to Tina) C'mon. She catches Tina's hand, leads her toward Godzilla.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Mom--don't we want to go-- (points in opposite direction) --that way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A transport helicopter cuts through the sky. Two Apache helicopters provide cover. The Gryphon sees them coming. Wheels toward them. The gun engage the Gryphon, peppering it with missiles. The door of the transport ‘copter slides back, revealing-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fleer and Aaron wear harnesses and radio headsets. Fleer showing Aaron the ropes--literally.

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: You ever repel before?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Yeah...some rock climbing in Yosemite. 102

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: Well, this is nothing like that. Here, you're in freefall, and you've only got two options to stop you. Option one's this little brake here.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: 115 And option two...? But Aaron realizes what Fleer's going to say--

dialogues.speaker: AARON/FLEER
dialogues.text: The ground. A gunship EXPLODES, shot down by the Gryphon, the blast m them shield their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: We've got to end this. The helicopter drops down between buildings, hiding the b from view.

dialogues.speaker: CHOPPER PILOT
dialogues.text: We're over him...Man, that's an ugly sucker. Fleer and Aaron look out, down at Godzilla. Godzilla is slumped against a building, almost upright. I two hundred feet from the restraining device to the groun

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: (deadpan) Whatever you do, don't look down. Aaron scowls at him. They clip their harnesses to lines. the lines down, past the silver restraining device.

dialogues.speaker: CHOPPER PILOT
dialogues.text: I'll hold her solid...but make it quick. They nod, prepare to step off--

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: You know what's funny? This doesn't seem weird... He and Aaron exchange a look. And then they go, out the d 103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JILL AND TINA round a corner. They help each other across huge fissure in the street, careful of electrical conduit  116 broken gas mains. They look up in time to see: Aaron and Fleer drop toward Godzilla, Fleer smoothly, Aar so.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Jeez--are they nuts? ON GODZILLA: as Fleer and Aaron slide past Godzilla's unconscious face. Fleer drops lightly onto the restrainin device, canted at an extreme angle. Aaron nearly misses t device. Fleer reaches out, hauls him on.

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: How you doing?

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Invigorated.... Fleer smiles, begins unpacking bricks of C-4 explosive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second Apache narrowly avoids a bolt from the Gryphon back. The Gryphon beats its wings furiously-- --the helicopter is blown backwards into the EMPIRE STATE BUILDING. It explodes, damaging the top floors of the bui The helicopter falls to the street below. The Gryphon wheels back toward Godzilla-- Two more missiles explode on its back. It SCREAMS, turns Pike's BLACK APACHE zooms past, peppering the Gryphon wit gunfire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gryphon sweeps past the copter, buffeting it. In fron them now, the Gryphon prepares to beat its wings like bef

dialogues.speaker: PIKE
dialogues.text: Put the building between us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pike's Apache sweeps behind the Empire State Building. Mo windows are blown out by the Gryphon's onslaught. The Gry circles the building, after the Apache. The Apache keeps building between them.  104.

dialogues.speaker: PIKE
dialogues.text: Fire through the building.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNER
dialogues.text: Sir..?

dialogues.speaker: PIKE
dialogues.text: Fire through the building.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNER
dialogues.text: Sir...that's the Empire State Building.

dialogues.speaker: PIKE
dialogues.text: (beat) And..? The Gunner has no response. He turns to his instruments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Missiles fire from the Apache, RIP THROUGH the top floors Empire State Building, hit the Gryphon. More missiles, mo hits. The Gryphon loses a little altitude. The top of the building shifts-- --then TOPPLES, mooring tower and all, onto the Gryphon, debris slamming into it, driving it down. The Gryphon hits the street, the wreckage raining down on half-burying it. It lies still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pike smiles.

dialogues.speaker: PIKE
dialogues.text: That's one. Let's make sure the other one doesn't get up, either.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNER
dialogues.text: What about the people--

dialogues.speaker: PIKE
dialogues.text: Acceptable losses. We'll build "em a monument. Go. The pilot turns the chopper toward Godzilla-- 117  118 105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pilot looks up-- Sees the Gunship, making a beeline for him. He is puzzled its attack posture. The chain guns open fire.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON GODZILLA: Bullets rip across Godzilla, toward Fleer an on the restraining device. They dive for what cover they find behind Godzilla's dorsals. ON JILL AND TINA: who see the attack.

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Aren't they on our side?

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Pike. ON PIKE: in the helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: PIKE
dialogues.text: (nonchalant) Missiles, please. ON THE GRYPHON: The pile of debris at the base of the Emp State Building shifts...then the Gryphon emerges from it. shakes itself off, sending up a cloud of masonry and dust It looks up-- And spots PIKE'S GUNSHIP. The Gryphon's eyes narrow, and it leaps into the air-- ON FLEER AND AARON: Fleer sees the missile launchers.

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: Uh-oh.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Uh-oh what? ON PIKE: Who smiles as the pilot puts a hand on the fire control. The targeting screen shows the restraining devic bang center--  119 THE GRYPHON HITS the chopper. Missiles fire. Hit the buil beside Godzilla, shrapnel spraying the transport helicopt The concessive force buffets it, pushes it toward the bui opposite-- ON GODZILLA: Fleer and Aaron are dragged across the devic The helicopter rotor dips, catches Aaron's line--it SNAPS ON GODZILLA: Fleer is still being hauled off the restrain device--he grabs at his harness release-- --the helicopter smashes into the building, falls-- --Fleer tumbles out of his harness as it is yanked away-- --but he's out in space, a long drop below-- --the helicopter CRASHES to into the street, explodes-- --Aaron grabs Fleer's arm-- Fleer slams into the side of the device--but he does not Aaron, lying prone, holds him.

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: ...thought I was going to use option two... Aaron grunts, hauls Fleer back up. ON PIKE'S APACHE: it spins out of control. The Gryphon's paw swipes across the cockpit--and the cockpit, pilot and are gone. The Apache hits a roof, crashes off, into the s below. Gryphon refocuses on Godzilla. Screams as it dives for hi Fleer and Aaron whirl-- See the Gryphon dropping straight for them, claws extende the kill-- --It SLAMS into the tops of the surrounding buildings. Th street is too narrow for its wingspan. It SCREAMS in frustration. Then spots:. A WIDE INTERSECTION. The Gryphon lands. Tries to move dow street toward Godzilla. Again, its wingspan is too wide. The Gryphon paces back and forth, snarls. Its eyes narrow idea occurs. It folds back its wings. Now it can fit betw the buildings. It crosses the fissure, stalks toward Godz  120 ON JILL AND TINA: who are between the Gryphon and Godzill Jill looks up at Aaron and Fleer, who are totally exposed

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Uh-oh... She looks around the street. Heads for an abandoned fuel tanker. It's locked. She SMASHES the window with a trash

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: Mom...you're getting a real jones for vandalism.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: I take after my daughter... Jill climbs into the cab...roots around in the back. Find road flares. Then looks at the ignition. Checks behind th visor. No keys.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Damn! From outside comes an eager snarl. ON AARON: who hears it, looks up--the Gryphon is uncomfor close. Fleer looks up, too--then returns to setting a tim

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: Ignore it. Just do the job. Aaron resumes reeling in the line still attached to his h but keeps a wary eye peeled.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: (under his breath) -..until you can't do the job. ON JILL: who grabs Tina's arm, hauls her into the truck

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: You can hot wire it, right? Tina's surprised--then nods. She scrambles beneath the dashboard. Strips out the wires quickly.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Remember: green to red...  121 Tina glances up at her, smiles, makes an adjustment. The grinds, then starts.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Can you drive it?

dialogues.speaker: TINA
dialogues.text: I can find first gear...

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Good enough...get it rolling toward that thing, then jump clear. Tina nods. Jill gives her a quick hug, a kiss, then climb of the cab, up on top of the truck. Tina puts it in gear--grinds 'em a little. Starts forward ON GODZILLA: Fleer pulls another timer out of the bag.

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: What? 108.

dialogues.speaker: FLEER
dialogues.text: One of 'em's busted...crap. (he looks up at Aaron) I can only set it for thirty seconds. Aaron looks at the street. The Gryphon is nearing, pickin way across broken chunks of pavement, crushing cars.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Thirty seconds can be a lifetime...Do it. Aaron ties his line off on the restraining device. Fleer up the explosives. ON JILL: as she scrambles back to the top hatch on the ta opens it. Lights the flares. The truck is heading for the Gryphon. The Gryphon stops.. cocks its head. What is this?

dialogues.speaker: JILL
